Caught in their nets is a mixture of seemingly random images and words: the headlines and newsmakers of the day, all manner of advertisements, athletes and historical figures, personal asides and not a little editorializing. Part core sample of an era and part personal diary, the drawings are seldom seen, especially in large numbers, which makes the exhibition of 44 of them at the Jonathan OHara Gallery an event of great interest.

title: Hoping to Unionize, Deliverymen Picket Upper West Side Restaurant
description: On a typical night on the Upper West Side, Jian Xie, 23, a bicycle deliveryman, can pedal 80 blocks or more roundtrip to deliver a single order of Vietnamese food.

title: Debate Over a Pardon Follows the Libby Verdict
description: WASHINGTON, March 7  If some people imagined a verdict in the criminal trial of I. Lewis Libby Jr. would calm the political passions surrounding his fate, they may have forgotten two words with a combustible history: presidential pardon.

title: Fast Start Propels Georgetown Past Villanova
description: Through nearly eleven minutes of play, several time outs, a technical foul on coach Jay Wright, and an array of misses, a single baseline jump shot separated Villanova from being shut out entirely.

title: In Sea of Blue and Gray, Tears for a Fallen Sergeant
description: NEWARK, March 7  The applause at Sgt. Tommaso Popolizios funeral echoed through the vast gothic cathedral, a rare and startling sound in the somber ceremony.

title: Yes, Those Were the Days
description: Three years ago I said some pessimistic things on TV about the war in Iraq. Scooter Libby called the next day. Methodically, though with a touch of wryness in his voice, he ran down a list of the hopeful developments he thought I was ignoring. Then as we were signing off, he interrupted himself and said: Anyway, thats the positive spin. I can do the negative spin just as well.

title: Anchor in a Desert War: Brian Williams, Reporting
description: There was no better illustration of the special difficulties network news anchors face in Iraq than Brian Williams standing alone earlier this week, surrounded by sandbags, describing the situation on the ground secondhand.

title: Load Up the Files for the Move to Vista
description: Computer hardware manufacturers predict that most people will buy new computers rather than try to upgrade older ones to run Windows Vista. But with all of those files and customized settings on the old computer, switching over is no simple task.

title: Masseuse or Masseur, Sir?
description: WHEN it comes to the skin- and health-care professionals who administer his facials and work the kinks out of his shoulders, David Yu, an airline pilot, chooses women.

title: Milford: Prosecutor on Leave During Inquiry
description: L. Mark Hurley, the state prosecutor who runs the lower-level Milford courthouse, has been placed on administrative leave pending the outcome an investigation by the state police and Connecticuts Division of Criminal Justice, his supervisors said yesterday. A supervisory assistant states attorney, Mr. Hurley, 47, has worked for two decades for the office, which declined to comment further. Lawyers with knowledge of the matter said Mr. Hurley was questioned earlier this week about how checks and money orders written by criminal defendants for restitution ended up in his account. Mr. Hurleys lawyer, Edward J. Gavin, said his client was fully cooperating with the investigation.

title: The Riches, Grifters in Sheeps Clothing
description: LOS ANGELES, March 7  If the common directive to aspiring writers is to write what you know, what are you to make of Dmitry Lipkin?

title: Songs of Love and Science
description: Jorge Drexler is the kind of songwriter who cheerfully explained, near the end of his concert at Town Hall on Tuesday, that he had based a song on the laws of conservation of matter and energy: Toda Se Transforma (Everything Transforms). In that song, the heat of a kiss has repercussions reaching distant galaxies.

title: Paulson Presses China on Opening Its Markets
description: SHANGHAI, March 8  Hoping to shift the debate about United States-China trade relations away from currency reform and the growing American trade deficit, Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said here today that China needed to quicken the pace of its economic reforms and do more to open its financial markets to foreign competition.

title: Next for the C.I.A.s Least Secret Officer: A Quieter Life
description: A life has ended for Valerie Wilson.

title: A Positive Prognosis and a New Outlook
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.

title: Board Chairman Quits Giant French Retailer; 2 Investors Buy Stakes
description: The resignation of the supervisory board chairman yesterday, coupled with a major share purchase by two big-name investors, fueled speculation of a shift in strategy at the French retailer Carrefour, which is struggling to meet fierce competition at home and abroad.

title: Floating on an Air of Indulgence
description: SUPPOSEDLY it was Christian Dior, who while working in his atelier with the legendary cobbler Roger Vivier, was moved to coin the word footwear. Imagine discussing Marie Antoinettes shoes! Dior was said to have exclaimed. From then on, M. Vivier, when speaking of his creations, never used the s-word again. Or so the story goes.

title: The Bare Minimum
description: Gainesville, Fla.

title: Turkey: Court Pulls Plug on YouTube
description: An Istanbul court ordered access to the video sharing Web site YouTubeblocked because of a clip on the site that was said to insult the nations revered founder, Mustafa Kemal Ataturk. Critical comments against Ataturk are barred by law. YouTube later said it had removed the clip, and another court ruling said access to the service could be restored. According to news reports, the clip was part of a virtual war of insults and name-calling being waged on YouTube between Turks and Greeks.

title: Bronx: Man Charged After Confrontation With Court Officer
description: A man who was shot by an off-duty court officer during an altercation on Tuesday evening has been charged with attempted murder, the police said yesterday. The man, James Carter, 31, of Murdock Avenue, was shot by the officer after he pulled a gun during an argument on Colgate Avenue, the police said. Mr. Carter fled, but was arrested after he sought treatment for an injured hand at Montefiore Medical Center, the police said.

title: Too Bad Theres No Credit for Lunch and Recess Here
description: The High Commission for Game Show Integrity, or whatever task force was founded after the quiz show scandals of the 50s, must have vetted Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader? before it appeared on the air last week. And yet theres something fishy  fishier, I mean, than usual with game shows  about this Fox hit, on which duncey adults match wits, sort of, with children.

title: Facing Rivals From Spain, E.On May End Bid for Endesa
description: FRANKFURT, March 7  The German energy giant E.On said Wednesday that it might abandon a yearlong effort to take over the utility company Endesa of Spain, or settle for just a slice of the company, now that it faces a battle with two other major shareholders and the Spanish government for control.

title: First Step a Positive One for Cuse
description: The buzz around Madison Square Garden when Syracuse and Connecticut took the floor for a Big East tournament matinee yesterday revolved around Syracuses glistening new uniforms.

title: Historians Fight Bush on Access to Papers
description: In December 1989, one month after the fall of the Berlin Wall, President George H. W. Bush and Mikhail Gorbachev met in Malta and, in the words of a Soviet spokesman, buried the cold war at the bottom of the Mediterranean.

title: Paul Secon, 91, Who Helped Found Pottery Barn Chain, Dies
description: Paul Secon, who in 1949 loaded the family station wagon with discontinued and slightly damaged ceramics from an upstate New York factory, drove to Manhattan and opened the first Pottery Barn store, died Feb. 24 at his home in Rochester. He was 91.

title: Atlantic Yards Loses Lease to Part of Site
description: As it moves forward on its plans for the Atlantic Yards project in Brooklyn, the developer Forest City Ratner has represented itself as controlling nearly all the property in the 22-acre footprint of the site.

title: Monologues Spurs Dialogue on Taste and Speech
description: CROSS RIVER, N.Y., March 7  The three girls had been warned by teachers not to utter the word. But they chose to say it anyway  vagina  in unison at a high school forum, and were swiftly punished by their school.

title: New York Label May Not Fit All in Giuliani Run
description: WASHINGTON, March 7  When Republicans say they are skeptical that Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former mayor of New York, can survive their partys presidential nominating process, they usually point to his record of support for abortion rights, gay rights and gun control.

title: Love of Your Team Can Soon Be Everlasting
description: For the baseball fan who has everything in the here and now, how about a team-licensed urn for his ashes in the hereafter?

title: Rebels Are Not Runnin From Past in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, March 7  For more than 15 years, as this desert city of neon lights and dusty subdivisions grew exponentially, its basketball team shrunk from view.

title: Manhattan: Rise in City Unemployment
description: The unemployment rate in New York City rose in January, after a year in which the job markets in the city and state were even stronger than initially reported, the State Department of Labor said yesterday. The rate of joblessness in the city, adjusted for seasonal fluctuation, was 4.9 percent in January, up from 4.4 percent in December. The states unemployment rate rose to 4.3 percent, from 4.1 percent in December, but was still lower than the national rate of 4.6 percent in January. The Labor Department revised its year-end figures for 2006 to show that the number of private sector jobs in the city increased by 2 percent during the year, matching the national rate. The city accounted for more than half of the new nonfarm jobs in the state in 2006.

title: Nets Need to Win Games, and Not Merely Play Hard
description: DALLAS, March 7  Eddie House seemed insulted, rebuffing a suggestion that the Nets drew something positive from Tuesday nights loss to the Mavericks.

title: An Unjust Expulsion
description: The Cherokee Nations decision to revoke the tribal citizenship of about 2,800 descendants of slaves once owned by the tribe is a moral low point in modern Cherokee history and places the tribe in violation of a 140-year-old federal treaty and several court decisions. The federal government must now step in to protect the rights of the freedmen, who could lose their tribal identities as well as access to medical, housing and other tribal benefits.

title: A Palm-Size DVD Camcorder and a Handful of Ambition
description: There are two kinds of camcorder users: those who like to record on tape for the picture quality, and those who like DVD and digital recording for the ease of viewing.

title: One Account of Abuse and Fear in Texas Youth Detention
description: HOUSTON, March 7  Joseph Galloway says he was molested at 15 by a female corrections officer in a Texas Youth Commission detention center and later raped by a fellow inmate as a guard stood by.

title: Buildup in Iraq Needed Into 08, U.S. General Says
description: WASHINGTON, March 7  The day-to-day commander of American forces in Iraq has recommended that the heightened American troop levels there be maintained through February 2008, military officials said Wednesday.

title: Exxon Plans to Lift Output a Million Barrels a Day
description: Exxon Mobil, the worlds biggest publicly traded oil company, which earned a record $39.5 billion last year, explained yesterday how it was going to spend all that cash.

title: Bruno Threatens to Undo Some of Spitzers Proposed Cuts
description: ALBANY, March 7  The State Senate majority leader, Joseph L. Bruno, delivered one of his sharpest and most specific attacks yet on Gov. Eliot Spitzers budget plan on Wednesday, pinpointing at least $300 million in proposed health care cuts that the Senate would probably try to restore.

title: Accidental Bosses Seize the Opportunities
description: When Archie Williams, an entrepreneur in Boston, died in his bed on Thanksgiving Day in 2002, his youngest daughter, Elizabeth, recalls confronting feelings that went beyond grief.

title: Whats on Thursday Night
description: 8 P.M. (IFC) THE YAKUZA PAPERS: BATTLES WITHOUT HONOR AND HUMANITY (1973). The American Mafia had the Godfather movies. Japanese crime syndicates had this five-film epic, directed by Kinji Fukasaku, about gangland conflicts in postwar Hiroshima  a bloody metaphor for Japans 1950s economic miracle,  Dave Kehr wrote in The New York Times. The Yakuza Papers broke Japanese box-office records but was considered too lowbrow to be exported during the 1970s, when it was made. Tonight IFC presents the entire saga, which traces nearly three violent decades in the life of Shozo Hirono, played by Bunta Sugawara, from soldier in the wake of the bombing of Hiroshima to brotherhood in a crime organization to retirement. The fifth film begins at 3 a.m.

title: Access to Mayor Doesnt Solve All Problems
description: NEWARK, March 7  Annie Miller came seeking a pass on a parking ticket. Ed Wadood needed a mayoral blessing for a local golf tournament. Roberta Ware, driven by a religious vision, beseeched Mayor Cory A. Booker to spread the Gospel to the citys wayward youth. Rasjohn Warren, an ex-convict, was looking for work.

title: City Disputes Judges Power to Limit Police Taping
description: Lawyers for the city have asked a federal judge to reconsider a sweeping ruling last month that ordered the New York Police Department to stop routine videotaping of public gatherings, saying that he lacked the power to make the ruling and suggesting that it would hurt efforts to deter terrorism.

title: Philadelphia Calls Off Winter for a Week
description: Philadelphia

title: Living Day to Day by a Gospel of Green
description: VIENNA, Va.

title: A Repeat Renovator Finds His Rhythm
description: AS a publicist who represents hip-hop stars, Chris Chambers has had his share of nerve-racking moments: Taking the client to dinner with a well-known designer and realizing, as the two of them are about to arrive, that said client is wearing some other designers clothes. Enduring the screams of the executive producer of Saturday Night Live after another client has missed the first day of rehearsal because he was out partying the night before.

title: How to Bottle a Generation
description: IN 1994, Calvin Klein designed a fragrance that embodied, in its flat little screw-top bottle, the disaffected, sexually ambivalent grunge youth of the moment. CK One, with its unconventional black and white advertisements filled with moping, androgynous models, was arguably the most perfectly tailored fragrance ever pitched to one market, breaking industry rules and records, selling 20 bottles per minute at its peak. A unisex brand that became the olfactory talisman of Generation X, CK One was so authentically grunge it was carried in record stores alongside albums by Nirvana.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: The Saturday Interview in Business Day on Feb. 24, with Intuits chief executive, Stephen M. Bennett, referred imprecisely to the portion of the companys business that generated $983 million in revenue. Although the amount indeed included revenue from the sale of tax-preparation software for consumers, it also included a small amount from software for businesses.

title: Undercover Detective Who Fired First Shot Testifies in Police Killing in Queens
description: An undercover police detective who fired the first of 50 police bullets at Sean Bells gray Nissan Altima outside a Queens strip club in November testified yesterday before the grand jury weighing evidence in the case.

title: Search Goes on for Victims of Earthquakes in Sumatra
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, March 7  Rescue teams on Wednesday continued searching collapsed buildings in western Sumatra for victims of two large earthquakes that struck Tuesday.

title: Updating Devices for Daylight Saving
description: Updating Devices

title: Crawford Injury Puts Strain on 2 Knicks
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y., March 7  The question was only halfway out when Eddy Curry started to chuckle. His expression gave away the answer before he said a word. Yes  absolutely, unequivocally yes  Curry misses his friend Jamal Crawford.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An obituary about the historian Arthur M. Schlesinger in some copies last Thursday, and in early-edition copies the next day, misstated the publication year of Johnny, We Hardly Knew Ye, a book about President John F. Kennedy by Kenneth P. ODonnell and David F. Powers, who wrote that President Kennedy saw some political risk in hiring Mr. Schlesinger, an ardent liberal, as an adviser. It was published in 1972, not 1970.

title: France: Paris, City of Bikes
description: By the end of the year, Paris hopes to have 20,600 bicycles available as low-cost rentals for residents and tourists. They are to be available at 1,000 pickup points around the city in an effort to ease traffic congestion, according to City Hall. The bikes may be rented on any day or night and returned to any station. Bike-for-hire networks have already been set up in Lyon, Brussels, Oslo and Stockholm.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Feb. 9 about subway delays caused by a cracked rail on the N, R and W lines in Manhattan carried incorrect information from transit officials about the location at which they began diverting Queens-bound R trains around the problem. The R trains first switched at 34th Street onto the express tracks normally used by the Q train; later, after exiting the 57th Street/7th Avenue station, they switched to the F line tracks and proceeded to Queens. The R trains did not switch to the F tracks at 34th Street.

title: Under the Radar Irish Bounce Syracuse
description: Coach Mike Brey has relished the stealth role of this Notre Dame basketball team. He smiled when mentioning that a columnist called the Irish the most under the radar 23-6 team in the country heading into the Big East tournament.

title: Arts, Briefly
description: The Louvre Emerges Smiling From Abu Dhabi Deal

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An art review on Tuesday about an exhibition of photographs by Henry Wessel, at the Museum of Modern Art in San Francisco, misidentified the site of the photograph showing a man in a business suit standing on an empty beach. It was San Francisco, not Malibu. The review also misspelled the first name of the salesman in Death of a Salesman, to whom the man standing on the beach was compared. He is Willy Loman, not Willie.

title: With Coal Plans Cut Back, Texas Faces Energy Gap
description: HOUSTON, March 2  Texas, as everyone knows, does everything big. Its giant oil and gas fields dominate Americas energy patch. It is now the nations largest wind power producer, with more than 2,000 turbines gathering some of the countrys strongest currents. It gets the booby prize for being the biggest producer of greenhouse gases.

title: 2 Accused of Trading in Cadaver Parts
description: LOS ANGELES, March 7 The former director of the cadaver donor program at the University of California, Los Angeles, and an associate have been charged with conspiracy and grand theft, accused of illegally trading body parts that had been donated for medical research, the authorities said Wednesday.

title: Candidates Illness Is Latest Obstacle for Nigerian Election
description: DAKAR, Senegal, March 7  At first, the rumor was that the patient was in a coma, taken off for emergency resuscitation. In the next swirl of speculation the patient was already dead, and preparations were being made for a hometown burial.

title: Children Were Visible in Neighborhoods Routine
description: Even in a neighborhood thick with children, in a borough with the highest percentage of children in the city, the children of 1022 Woodycrest Avenue in the Bronx were known if not by name, then by sight.

title: Swearing-In Still in Doubt, Council Says
description: The New York City Board of Elections is expected this afternoon to certify Mathieu Eugene as the winner of last months special election for a City Council seat representing central Brooklyn.

title: Winthrop D. Jordan, Expert in the History of Race Relations in America, Is Dead at 75
description: Winthrop D. Jordan, a National Book Award-winning historian who wrote several influential works on American slavery and race relations, died on Feb. 23 at his home in Oxford, Miss. He was 75.

title: Brooklyn: Teacher Charged With Rape
description: A speech teacher at Intermediate School 166 in East New York was arrested yesterday and charged with rape, sexual abuse and endangering the welfare of a child, said Richard J. Condon, the special commissioner of investigation for the city schools. Mr. Condon said the teacher, Marcia Amsterdam, 30, was arrested after city investigators determined that she had had intercourse with a 13-year-old boy at the school. Ms. Amsterdam was removed from the school and placed on administrative duty, Mr. Condon added. Officials said Ms. Amsterdam had taught at the school since 2000 and had worked in the city schools since 1999. The city Education Department declined to comment, saying the investigation was continuing.

title: David Johnston, Who Saw the Mayor About a Job
description: An ex-convict who served four years for selling drugs, Mr. Johnston went to the office hours sessions in September and October to see the mayor about a job with the city maintaining boilers, work he has done before.

title: A Buff New Look Takes the Court
description: WHEN Syracuse took the floor yesterday at Madison Square Garden for a Big East tournament game against Connecticut, the players were suddenly fashion plates. They were wearing a new design in basketball uniforms: taut body-fitting jerseys seamlessly tucked into baggy shorts.

title: Patrick Hopes a Fresh Start Will Lead to a Better Finish
description: Even the dashboard inside Danica Patricks Indy car looks different.

title: St. John's Return Ends Quickly
description: Last month, Lamont Hamilton of St. Johns spoke optimistically of the Red Storms return to the Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden for the first time since 2003. Its not the same without us, said Hamilton, a senior forward who is the leading scorer and rebounder.

title: Unconventional Twist in Yoga: Younger Teachers
description: MOST first jobs require the bare minimum: fetch coffee, take meeting notes, dress up or down as appropriate. But teaching yoga requires not only a knowledge of anatomy and alignment but also more intangible qualities. Radiating calm. Embodying wisdom. Being centered.

title: Now, When Youre on Hold, You Can Choose the Music
description: Most music phones so far have been an amalgam of two disparate technologies, but the Nokia 5300 XpressMusic may be on the verge of getting it right.

title: Russian Ex-Diplomat Guilty in Bribe Case
description: Vladimir Kuznetsov, a former Russian diplomat who once headed the United Nations budget oversight committee, was convicted by a federal jury in Manhattan of having conspired with a United Nations purchasing officer to obtain $300,000 in illicit payments from foreign companies seeking contracts. He was found guilty of setting up an offshore company and opening up a bank account in Antigua to launder money received from the officer, Alexander Yakovlev, who has admitted receiving nearly $1 million in bribes from United Nations contractors. He testified against Mr. Kuznetsov.

title: Education Dept. Is Urged to Explain Loan Subsidy
description: Lawmakers from both parties are pressuring the Education Department to explain why it let a student loan company keep $278 million in subsidies that an audit found improper.

title: In Europe, Germany May Have to Take the Wheel in Going Green
description: GENEVA, March 6  Europe prides itself on its pioneering approach to climate change  a commitment that Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany aims to deepen in her term as president of the European Union.

title: Venus Plots New Career Trajectory
description: When Venus called, Larry Scott knew it wasnt to chat or catch up on the latest Tour gossip.

title: At the Polls, Northern Ireland Tries to Resurrect Self-Rule
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 7  Every new development is a historic turning point in the politics of Northern Ireland, except when it isnt. Deadlines come and go. Progress creeps along, stalls, then sputters back to life.

title: U.S. Accuses Walgreen of Racial Bias
description: The Walgreen Company, the nations largest drugstore chain, discriminated against thousands of black employees across the country, including managers and pharmacists, according to a class-action lawsuit filed yesterday by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission.

title: California: Verdict in Death by Truck
description: DaimlerChrysler AG lost a $55.2 million verdict in a lawsuit filed by the family of a man run over and killed by his 1992 Dodge Dakota pickup after he exited the truck. A California jury held DaimlerChrysler liable for $5.2 million in compensatory damages for wrongful death and $50 million in punitive damages, said Scott Nealey, a lawyer with Lieff Cabraser Heimann & Bernstein in San Francisco who represented the plaintiffs. Richard Mraz, 38, died from head injuries after his truck ran over him. Jurors found that DaimlerChrysler was negligent in the design of the vehicles automatic transmission, which caused the truck to go into reverse after Mr. Mraz believed it was in park, according to the statement.

title: Jordans King Seeks Greater U.S. Role in Peace Effort
description: WASHINGTON, March 7  King Abdullah II of Jordan made a passionate appeal on Wednesday for the United States to take the lead in pursuing Arab-Israeli peace, telling Congress that without progress on that issue, none of the Middle Easts other problems would be solved.

title: Bush Faces Clash of Agendas in Latin America
description: SO PAULO, Brazil, March 8  President Bush arrived here tonight for the start of what he has portrayed as a We Care tour aimed at dispelling perceptions that he has neglected his southern neighbors.

title: A Sexy Witch, Zombies and Death: Who Needs a Story?
description: Could no one come up with a better title for an action game featuring a gun-toting sorceress than Bullet Witch, from Cavia? Ill admit the title is very clear, like a restaurant called the Tasty Food Diner, but does one really need a title that screams out, Look, this game has witches! And guns! How cool is that!?

title: EBays Founder Selects Philanthropy Director
description: The founder of eBay, Pierre Omidyar, has named a new leader for his personal philanthropy as he explores ways to play a bigger role in shaping public policy.

title: In Spartan Space, Jazz in a Communal Mode
description: Ralph Alessi has a prodigious trumpet technique, and a pedigree worthy of it: His father was a celebrated classical trumpeter, and his brother is the principal trombonist with the Metropolitan Opera. Mr. Alessi was probably headed for an orchestral career himself until a hard turn toward improvisation at the California Institute of the Arts. It was the right decision, given that what Mr. Alessi prizes in music is not the impeccable but the ineffable: the thrill of seeking but not knowing.

title: Howl? Nay, Express His Lighter Purpose
description: So you were expecting maybe a majestic, troubling, tragic King Lear? Oh please, that is so last century. With the world on a fast track to hell, you surely dont want to endure three hours of cosmic misery as entertainment. Instead, chill out and embrace the new Lear Lite, brought to you by the Public Theater, which features New Age music, eye-soothing color-coordinated costumes and the charming Kevin Kline in the title role.

title: University Fund Manager to Join Firm
description: Robert Boldt, who managed the $19 billion endowment of the University of Texas, is planning to join Perella Weinberg Partners, according to people briefed on the plan.

title: Democrats Propose Iraq Pullout in 2008
description: WASHINGTON, March 8  Democratic leaders in the House and Senate began a new legislative push today for the withdrawal of combat troops from Iraq in 2008, coalescing behind a fixed timetable to end the war for the first time since assuming power.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Tuesday about the National Vocabulary Championship for high school students misspelled a word described as one of several that the students would likely know. It is nidicolous, not nidicoulous. (For those of us not in the know, it means: remaining in the nest for some time after hatching, as some birds; or living in the nest of another species.)

title: Denying Rights in Nigeria
description: A poisonous piece of legislation is quickly making its way through the Nigerian National Assembly. Billed as an anti-gay-marriage act, it is a far-reaching assault on basic rights of association, assembly and expression. Chillingly, the legislation  proposed last year by the administration of President Olusegun Obasanjo  has the full and enthusiastic support of the leader of Nigerias powerful Anglican church. Unless the international community speaks out quickly and forcefully against the bill, it is almost certain to become law.

title: Garden Q.&A.
description: Alternatives to a Runaway Vine

title: Sex Offender Guilty of Rape and Murder of Florida Girl
description: MIAMI, March 7  A registered sex offender was convicted here Wednesday in the kidnapping, rape and murder of a 9-year-old girl who had been buried alive in plastic bags near the mobile home where he lived.

title: Roys Legacy: Spreading the Wings of a Butterfly
description: QUEBEC, March 3  Most goaltenders for playoff-bound N.H.L. teams are at least 6 feet tall, several speak French and nearly all play the same style. Their hockey DNA can be traced to a common ancestor, Patrick Roy.

title: Calendar
description: Gardening in Brooklyn

title: In an Unexpected Silence, Visions of Loss and Desperation
description: Everything seemed to be running smoothly at the gala evening for the Paul Taylor Dance Company on Tuesday at City Center. The curtain rose on time, the inevitable latecomers werent disruptive, and for once there were no unnecessary speeches by board members about the breathtaking art of dance.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about an American doctor and her daughter who were severely sickened by poisoning while vacationing in Moscow referred incorrectly to Interfax, the news agency that reported the development. It is privately owned, not an official enterprise controlled by the government. (Go to Article)

title: Bo Peeps Sheep Found!
description: LOOKING at the tail end of the monthlong caravan of fashion shows, one might take in the menagerie of barnyard moments on the runways of Europe and wonder if designers had checked into a funny farm.

title: Ex-Teacher, Suing L.I. School District, Says She Was Accused of Witchcraft
description: CENTRAL ISLIP, N.Y., March 7  Taking the stand in United States District Court here on Wednesday, Lauren Berrios  with a stylish white blouse, black slacks, coiffed hair, no pointy black hat  hardly looked like a witch.

title: My Very Own Juror
description: WASHINGTON

title: Denial Reopens Wounds of Japans Ex-Sex Slaves
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 7  Wu Hsiu-mei said she was 23 and working as a maid in a hotel in 1940 when her Taiwanese boss handed her over to Japanese officers. She and some 15 other women were sent to Guangdong Province in southern China to become sex slaves.

title: The New Niche: Hair Care for Men Without
description: THE same week a Los Angeles salon owner was pleading with Britney Spears not to buzz her head, barbers were laying tracks across the scalps of all sorts of men at the Aidan Gill for Men salon in New Orleans.

title: A Maturing Leader Energizes a Venerable Ensemble
description: Since its founding more than 250 years ago by a group of music-minded merchants the Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra has gone through 18 music directors, including Mendelssohn, and many changes. The new dynamism that this eminent orchestra displayed at Carnegie Hall on Monday and Tuesday nights is surely attributable to its 19th music director, the Italian conductor Riccardo Chailly. After Tuesday nights concert ended with an arresting, organic and richly colored account of Mahlers daunting Fifth Symphony, the audience responded with the most ecstatic ovation I have witnessed this season at Carnegie Hall.

title: Utah: New Charge for Sect Leader
description: Warren S. Jeffs, leader of a polygamous religious sect, faces a new federal charge of unlawful flight to avoid prosecution, the United States attorney for Utah, Brett L. Tolman, said. Mr. Jeffs, 51, head of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, already faces felony sex charges in Utah and Arizona courts. He is in custody in Washington County, Utah, awaiting trial on two charges of rape as an accomplice for arranging a so-called spiritual marriage of a 14-year-old girl to an adult man. His lawyers asked a Utah court this week to move the trial to Salt Lake City, citing a public opinion survey showing a high level of prejudice against him in Washington County. Mr. Jeffs was a fugitive on the F.B.I.s most wanted list for five months in 2006.

title: Microsoft Executive Leaving
description: The Microsoft executive who had led the effort to close the gap on Google, the dominant search engine, is leaving the company, executives close to Microsoft said last night.

title: U.S. Commander in Iraq Sees Long Commitment
description: BAGHDAD, March 8  The new American commander in Iraq, Gen. David H. Petraeus, warned today that American troops here face a long road ahead, and left open the possibility that even more soldiers would be called to serve here, as he described the difficult task of bringing peace to the country.

title: Lessons From the Walter Reed Scandal (4 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Theres Plenty of Jos Reyes to Go Around and Around
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 7  The Wilson A2000 catchers mitt was ordered by Jos Reyes, addressed to Jos Reyes, and placed in Jos Reyess locker. But when Jos Reyes opened the package, he had to shake his head. Not again, he thought. So Reyes did what anyone would have done. He gave the mitt to Jos Reyes.

title: Villanova Dispatches DePaul From Big East
description: Villanovas Scottie Reynolds and Curtis Sumpter did not play in last years Big East tournament. Reynolds was still in high school, and Sumpter missed the season with a torn ligament in his left knee.

title: A Neither/Nor Candidate for President in France
description: PARIS, March 7  In the final weeks of the French presidential campaign, dominated by a nurturing Socialist and a crime-busting conservative, a third candidate has upended the race with a very American theme: put partisanship aside and end the false promises of the big parties.

title: Suicide Shootings at Schools in Michigan and Texas
description: CHICAGO, March 7  A 17-year-old shot his ex-girlfriend four times Wednesday as they talked in the parking lot of her central Michigan high school and then fatally shot himself in the head, the authorities said.

title: 8 Children Are Among Dead in Bronx Fire
description: Eight children and an adult were killed in a fire in the Bronx on Wednesday night that raced up from the basement of a more than 100-year-old wooden building where 22 people from immigrant families lived, the authorities said.

title: Drug Manager Raises Its Bid for Caremark but Sees Delay
description: Express Scripts yesterday sweetened its $26.1 billion offer for Caremark Rx, a fellow drug-benefit manger, but cautioned that the bid would be delayed by further regulatory scrutiny.

title: Journey From a Chinese Orphanage to a Jewish Rite of Passage
description: Of the 613 laws in the Torah, the one that appears most often is the directive to welcome strangers. The girl once known as Fu Qian has been thinking about that a lot lately.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: A chart yesterday with an article about jury deliberations in the trial of I. Lewis Libby Jr. misspelled the given name of a juror in some copies. As the article noted, he is Denis Collins, not Dennis.

title: Shareholders of Take-Two Plot a Revolt
description: A consortium of investors disclosed yesterday that it intended to oust the board and possibly the top management of Take-Two Interactive Software, a video-game publisher that has been plagued by legal, regulatory and accounting problems.

title: Hooked on Storage
description: Gaithersburg, Md.

title: Internet Start-Up to Take a Hybrid Media Approach
description: Several cable television veterans are putting their band back together and taking their act to the Internet.

title: Radiation Drugs Canceled
description: Health and Human Services canceled an effort to acquire radiation exposure drugs intended to help in the aftermath of a terrorist attack. It is the second major cancellation in recent months of a push to acquire drugs or vaccines for the so-called BioShield stockpile. Health officials said that none of the applications for the radiation treatment met the requirements.

title: The Gonzales Eight
description: Americans often suspect that their political leaders are arrogant and out of touch. But even then it is nearly impossible to fathom what self-delusion could have convinced Senator Pete Domenici of New Mexico that he had a right to call a federal prosecutor at home and question him about a politically sensitive investigation.

title: Inquiry Into Ouster of U.S. Attorneys Moves Toward Subpoenas at Justice Department
description: WASHINGTON, March 7  The Senate Judiciary Committee on Wednesday took the first step toward issuing subpoenas to five Justice Department officials whose names have surfaced in Congressional testimony about the dismissals of eight United States attorneys.

title: For Bluetooth Headset, That This-Century Look
description: Bluetooth headphones are rarely attractive enough to wear in mixed company. Kosss new Cobalt headphones manage to deliver wireless audio without looking like a prop from Star Trek.

title: Captain America Is Dead; National Hero Since 1941
description: Captain America, a Marvel Entertainment superhero, is fatally shot by a sniper in the 25th issue of his eponymous comic, which arrived in stores yesterday. The assassination ends the sentinel of libertys fight for right, which began in 1941.

title: As Spring Championships Begin, a Trip Back to St. Louis, 1997
description: The Spring North American Bridge Championships of the American Contract Bridge League begin today in the Americas Center in downtown St. Louis, not far from the Gateway Arch.

title: Survivors Describe Horror of Plane Crash in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, March 7  A television cameraman leaped from a burning aircraft on Wednesday and filmed his fellow survivors staggering away from the crash as bright orange flames and columns of black smoke poured from the broken fuselage.

title: Kazakhstan and China Deadlock Over Depletion of a Major Lake
description: ALMATY, Kazakhstan, March 7  A conference that convened here this week to address the fate of an ecologically threatened Central Asian basin the size of California has ended in stalemate between Kazakhstan and China, the two countries most reliant on its waters.

title: The Sculptor in the Garden Neednt Wait for Spring
description: THE best way I know to describe the biological urge to garden against all odds is to tell the story of my father and his tulips.

title: Paulson Urges China to Open Its Markets More Quickly
description: SHANGHAI, Thursday, March 8  Hoping to shift the debate in United States-China trade relations away from currency reform and the growing American trade deficit, Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said Thursday that China needed to quicken the pace of its economic reforms and do more to open its financial markets to foreign competition.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Lottery Numbers

title: Trying to Preserve a Beloved Botanical Gem
description: KINGSTON, Wash.  Amateur gardeners by the thousands used to herald the arrival of spring with a pilgrimage to an artificial paradise here known as Heronswood.

title: West Virginia Employs Long Ball to Make Case
description: No matchup in the first round of the Big East tournament better epitomized the desperate nature of this week more than the game between No. 7-seeded West Virginia and No. 10 Providence.

title: Calhoun Wont Take This Sitting Down
description: Where is Boston College? Where are Looie Carneseccas ghastly sweaters? And what in the world were DePaul and Marquette doing in the Big East Conference tournament yesterday?

title: U.S. Freezes Assets in Latvia in Stock Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (Dow Jones)  United States securities regulators obtained an emergency court order freezing $3 million of proceeds in a Latvian account suspected of being used to hack into online brokerage accounts and manipulate stock trading.

title: The Future of Leisure That Never Arrived
description: In 1930 the British economist John Maynard Keynes predicted that the biggest problem facing future generations would be what to do with all their leisure time.

title: Albany: State Auditor Suspended Amid Investigation
description: A state auditor who is being investigated for approving more than $1.2 million in payments to a company he owned was suspended without pay yesterday, officials said. The auditor, James L. Leggiero, is being investigated by the office of State Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo for approving dozens of state payments to what investigators described as a sham entity that he then used to make mortgage and car payments. Mr. Leggiero was suspended from the states Office of Mental Health yesterday, and officials there were preparing to fire him, said Jill Daniels, an agency spokeswoman. Mr. Leggiero did not return a telephone call yesterday.

title: A 9/11 Reminder (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Brooklyn: Dead Man Found in Car
description: The body of a man was found in a car with a gunshot wound to the head last night, the police said. The victim, who was in his 20s, was not immediately identified. The body was found shortly before 8 p.m. in the front seat of a red Dodge Magnum parked in front of 350 Rogers Avenue in Flatbush.

title: Bronx House Fire Kills 8 Children
description: Eight children died and six others were injured in a fire that broke out about 11 p.m. yesterday in a four-story, multiple-family home in the Bronx, Fire Department officials said.

title: A Verdict for Libby, a Cloud for the White House (9 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: The Price of Progress: Transforming Islams Holiest Site
description: MECCA, Saudi Arabia  Five times a day across the globe devout Muslims face this city in prayer, focused on a site where they believe Abraham built a temple to God. The spot is also the place Muslims are expected to visit at least once in their lives.

title: Residential Sales
description: Manhattan

title: A Doubt-Filled Dancer, an Assured Audience
description: Philippe Decoufl has made a habit of dazzling audiences with a canny mix of movement, film, humor and visual poetry. And just about everybody who is anybody in New York dance  well, at least a half-dozen of them  was in attendance on Tuesday at the Joyce Theater for the opening of Mr. Decoufls Solo: Le Doute MHabite (The Doubt Within Me).

title: Homeless Families in City Shelters Hit Record, Despite the Mayors Efforts
description: The number of homeless families living in New York City shelters reached a record high last month, halfway into the Bloomberg administrations five-year plan to reduce homelessness by two-thirds, according to a report released yesterday by an advocacy group using city figures.

title: The Hard Drive as Eye Candy
description: THE hard drive, like all the parts inside a computer, is a commodity. While there may be some quality differences between the makers products, manufacturers generally compete on little more than price. All hard drives do pretty much the same thing: store and retrieve data.

title: With Pettitte Pitching, Clemens Pays Yanks a Visit
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 7  The elevator carrying Roger Clemens stopped on the third floor at Legends Field on Wednesday night. People were waiting for him in the YES broadcast booth. But instead of turning right and heading there, Clemens veered left. There was someone he wanted to see: the Yankees principal owner, George Steinbrenner.

title: Woods the Host of a New Event
description: One month after the PGA Tour lost the International to a lack of corporate sponsorship and a lack of Tiger Woods, the Tour announced yesterday that AT&T would sponsor its replacement in the Washington area.

title: Some Lawyers Urge More Safeguards on Rights in Corporate Fraud Cases
description: Some lawmakers are questioning the Justice Departments recently revised guidelines on combating corporate fraud, asking whether they do enough to protect the confidentiality of legal communications and the right to legal counsel.

title: Apoon Awalla, Who Operated Two Newsstands That Were Demolished
description: Mr. Awalla begged the mayor at the October office hours to stop the demolition of two newsstands he had operated at Broad and Market Streets, Newarks busiest intersection, since 1980. The demolitions had been ordered by Mr. Bookers predecessor, Sharpe James, as part of a street-improvement project.

title: After Libby Trial, New Era for Government and Press
description: The investigation and trial of I. Lewis Libby Jr., who was Vice President Dick Cheneys chief of staff, will have many legacies and lessons  for government officials, for supporters and critics of special prosecutors and for historians of the events leading to the war in Iraq.

title: Fed Survey Finds Signs of a Slowdown in Some Areas
description: In Hawaii, hotel bookings are down slightly. In Texas, the frenzied pace of expansion in the energy industry has slowed. In New York, demand for all types of loans is off.

title: 3 Guatemalan Security Officials Resign in Wake of Killings
description: GUATEMALA CITY, March 7  Three of Guatemalas top security officials submitted their resignations Wednesday in a deepening scandal surrounding the deaths of four police officers who were implicated in a quadruple homicide last month and subsequently killed while in custody.

title: A New Box From Sony Turns Videotapes Into Shiny DVDs
description: Citizens of ancient cultures made no multimedia records of their own birthday parties, weddings or babies first steps. How tragic and boring. When they sat down in front of the TV after dinner at family gatherings, what on earth did they watch?

title: Out of Jail, Out of Options, Out on a Limb
description: Theres no great case to be made for Matthew Kleins Con Ed, a bright swindling-scam comedy set in the world of the Internet nouveau-riche. Its not a groundbreaking book. Its just funny, full of tricks and very, very hard to put down.

title: Turkey: YouTube Blocked Over Content Found Offensive
description: A court ordered the YouTube Web site blocked throughout Turkey because of a video deemed insulting to Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of modern Turkey. The ban followed a week of what the news media termed a virtual war of videos between Greeks and Turks on YouTube. The largest Internet provider, Turk Telecom, complied with the ban and cut off access to the site. Insulting Ataturk is a criminal offense in Turkey.

title: An Aspiring Moguls Quick Rise and Fall
description: LOS ANGELES, March 7  The journey of Henry Winterstern is a classic Hollywood tale: of this towns irresistible lure, the particular hunger it breeds and the hubris that so often leads to a sudden demise. But this rapid rise and fall came with some trendy hedge-fund trimmings.

title: Yep, Thats Quite a Band, but Its Days Are Numbered
description: Occasionally you hear jazz performed thats so detailed, chiseled and compressed with energy that its hard to imagine the musicians doing it twice a night, six nights in a row. Such is the case with the pianist Kenny Werners quintet at Dizzys Club this week.

title: Lift the Curtain
description: Neglect, incompetence, indifference, lies.

title: The Rangers Wounded Are Barely Walking
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y., March 7  A day before another crucial game against the Islanders, the Rangers workout room was crammed with players in various stages of disrepair.

title: New Focus on Corzine and His Gifts to Union Chief
description: TRENTON, March 7  Union leaders and Republicans here on Wednesday questioned Gov. Jon S. Corzines financial entanglements with a union president with whom he was once romantically involved, as information came to light showing that she recently bought a $1.1 million condominium in the same Hoboken building where he lives.

title: European Union Urges Britain Not to Scuttle Open-Skies Agreement
description: PARIS, March 7  European transportation officials urged Britain Wednesday not to scuttle a landmark deal on trans-Atlantic air travel because of opposition by its biggest carriers to opening up Heathrow Airport, which serves London.

title: A Camera That Makes You and Your Pet Look Better
description: Digital cameras that remove red eye caused by a flash are now common. But what about removing the glow-eye that appears in flash photography of dogs and cats, the second most-photographed subjects after children? Hewlett-Packards new R837 digital camera does just that.

title: Slim Suits: The Attraction Is Physical
description: WONDROUS planetary alignments may excite astronomers, but not the average Joe, who just wants to see a nice comet. The same is true in the slow-moving world of mens wear. But a harmonic convergence in tropical-weight wool is taking place even as we speak, and men should listen up, because it will probably affect their lives a lot more than Mercury going into retrograde ever will.

title: In Lice, Clues to Human Origin and Attire
description: One of the more embarrassing mysteries of human evolution is that people are host to no fewer than three kinds of louse while most species have just one.

title: NIT Picked?
description: St. Johns put up a valiant effort without star big man Lamont Hamilton tonight but ended up falling to Marquette, 76-67. The Red Storm shut down star Marquette guard Dominic James, who finished the night 2-for-14 shooting with five turnovers. St. Johns got a huge night from Aaron Spears, who had a career high 18 points.

title: Love That Dirty Water?
description: If theres one thing you can expect from the Big East Tournament, its consistency. Its a lot of the same faces, good media set up and the unspoken seating protocol. The New York Times seats inside the arenas bowels are always in the front row toward the right side, in concert with our telephone line.

title: Office Hours With Newark's Mayor
description: In a rare move for a big city mayor, Newark Mayor Cory A. Booker holds monthly office hours sessions for residents to voice their concerns and seek help.

title: Music Video: Marnie Stern
description: A music video of "Every Single Line" by Marnie Stern.

title: Life in Pictures
description: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.

title: Transforming Moments
description: Photos from the Broadway revival of "Prelude to a Kiss."

title: Pemex's Troubles
description: Pemex, Mexicos oil monopoly, is struggling, with falling production and reserves and no money to reverse the slide.

title: A Family Journey
description: Images from Mira Nair's "The Namesake."

title: 10-minute interview
description: Alan Cummings reception.

title: Drug Manager Raises Caremark Bid but Sees Delay
description: Express Scripts raised its $26.1 billion bid for Caremark Rx, a rival drug-benefit manager, on Wednesday but cautioned that the bid would be delayed by further regulatory scrutiny. In raising its bid, Express Scripts sought to prolong an already tough battle for Caremark, which is twice its size. Both Express Scripts and its competing bidder, CVS, the nations largest pharmacy chain, have exchanged barbed remarks to win shareholder support for their offers.

title: Bank of America Bids Adieu to Venture Arm
description: Scale Venture Partners is saying adios to Bank of America as it closes its second fund. The former venture arm of Bank of America (BA Venture Partners) said Wednesday that because of high demand from outside investors to participate in the $400 million fund, the bank made a graceful exit from the fund.

title: U.S. Freezes Assets in Latvia in Stock Inquiry
description: United States securities regulators obtained an emergency court order freezing $3 million of proceeds in a Latvian account suspected of being used to hack into online brokerage accounts and manipulate stock trading.

title: Cirrus Logic Chief Resigns Over Options
description: David D. French, chief executive of the chip maker Cirrus Logic, has resigned over his involvement in the companys past stock option grant practices, the company said on Wednesday. Michael L. Hackworth, the former chief executive and current chairman, will be acting chief of the company he helped found, Cirrus said in announcing the results of an internal inquiry.

title: Bombay Stock Exchange Sells Stake to Singapore Market
description: Inflation fears and volatility are not dampening the expansion plans of stock exchanges in India. The Bombay Stock Exchange sold a 5 percent stake Wednesday to the Singapore Stock Exchange for 1.89 billion India rupees, ($42.6 million), and the exchange in Calcutta said it planned to sell 51 percent of its shares to partners and strategic investors in increments of about 5 percent each.

title: Indias Oxbow Takes Aim at Canadas Great Lakes
description: Oxbow Carbon & Minerals Holdings is bidding 820 million Canadian dollars for the coke producer Great Lakes Carbon Income Fund of Toronto, bidding 13 Canadian dollars a unit to top a competing suitor.

title: EBays Founder Selects Philanthropy Director
description: The founder of eBay, Pierre Omidyar, has named a new leader for his personal philanthropy as he explores ways to play a bigger role in shaping public policy.

title: From Gaud to Dal
description: Images from "Barcelona and Modernity" at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Preparing for Glory
description: Images from "300."

title: Environmental Group in TXU Deal Goes Wall Street
description: Environmental Defense has hired Perella Weinberg Partners, the boutique firm founded by the veteran investment banker Joseph R. Perella, to advise it as the group takes an unusual role in the $38 billion buyout of the Texas energy giant TXU, The New York Times reported. In hiring a banker, the influential environmental group is taking a page from Wall Streets deal-making playbook and may be seeking an even more powerful seat at the bargaining table with TXU and its suitors.

title: Internet Start-Up to Take a Hybrid Media Approach
description: Several cable television veterans are putting their band back together and taking their act to the Internet. Next New Networks, a New York-based Internet start-up run and backed by former executives of MTV and Nickelodeon, will announce plans today to begin a series of video-oriented Web sites  what the company calls micro-networks  on niche topics like do-it-yourself fashion, comic books, car racing and cartoons.

title: Friendly Ice Cream to Consider Sale
description: Friendly Ice Cream, a 72-year-old chain known for its sandwiches and sundaes, said it had hired Goldman Sachs to explore a possible sale of the company. Friendly, which has been under pressure from an activist shareholder, could attract interest from middle-market private equity firms that invest in franchised restaurant chains, The Deal said.

title: Two Online Gambling Sites Hold Merger Talks
description: Sportingbet, the British online gambling company, is in takeover talks with the Austrian online bookmaker Bwin. Sportingbet was forced by the Britains Takeover Panel to issue a statement Wednesday confirming the talks after deal rumors swept the market and set off a sharp rise in the companys share price.

title: Will Barings Leeson Get Back in the Game?
description: In another reincarnation in a long line of second acts in the financial services industry, Nick Leeson, the rogue trader who brought down Barings Bank in the 1990s, said he might return to full-time trading  but only for himself.

title: Lawyers Call for More Rights in Corporate Fraud Cases
description: Some lawmakers are questioning the Justice Departments recently revised guidelines on combating corporate fraud, asking whether they do enough to protect the confidentiality of legal communications and the right to legal counsel. At a hearing Thursday, two former federal prosecutors and other prominent lawyers are expected to tell the House Judiciary subcommittee and its chairman, Representative Robert C. Scott, Democrat of Virginia, that the new guidelines, known as the McNulty memorandum, are inadequate and do not protect basic legal rights.

title: Goldman Names Investment Banking C.O.O.
description: Goldman Sachs named Gregg Lemkau chief operating officer of investment banking. He had been co-head of healthcare investment banking at the firm.

title: In a Buyout, Chrysler Would Bring Big Challenges
description: Chrysler is drawing interest from private equity funds, but the United States-based automakers substantial losses and its need for capital expenditures would make a traditional leveraged buyout extremely challenging, The Deal suggests. Chrysler needs radical structural changes, and legacy costs have to be dealt with before it can be an attractive acquisition candidate, Van Conway of the automotive restructuring firm Conway MacKenzie & Dunleavy said.

title: As Hurdles Mount, E.On May End Bid for Endesa
description: The German energy giant E.On said Wednesday that it might abandon a yearlong effort to take over the utility company Endesa of Spain, or settle for just a slice of the company, now that it faces a battle with two other major shareholders and the Spanish government. The decision by E.On reflects the emergence of a new shareholder, the Italian utility Enel, which seems determined to foil the Germans bid. Enel bought about 10 percent of Endesa last week and obtained options to purchase 12 percent more.

title: TXU Deal May Stoke Alternative Energy
description: All those investors in clean energy might want to buy a ticket for Texas. The New York Times reports that the agreement by TXU bidders Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and the Texas Pacific Group to scrap plans for eight new coal-fired plants is likely to increase the potential shortfall in the states energy supply, creating opportunities for entrepreneurs of green tech and renewable energy.

title: Citi Faces Obstacles in Japanese Bid
description: Some early obstacles are emerging to Citigroups big Asia bid, which it announced Wednesday. The banks $10.8 billion offer for Japanese brokerage Nikko Cordial was being touted as a much-needed coup for Citigroups chief executive, Charles O. Prince III, who has been under pressure from shareholders to improve firms performance.

title: Greenhill Vice Chairman Returns to His Roots
description: Greenhill & Companys vice chairman, Harvey Miller, who built Weil, Gotshal & Manges into a bankruptcy powerhouse before he left in 2002, is ending his stint in investment banking to return to his roots. On Wednesday, Mr. Miller said that he would be rejoining Weil as a partner after spending the last five years at Greenhill, a boutique investment bank. Mr. Miller told The American Lawyer that he was returning to an old love.

title: Man Group Shares Slide As Key Fund Falters
description: Shares of the Man Group, the worlds largest publicly traded hedge-fund manager, bucked the trend Wednesday in a higher London market, retreating after the company disclosed poor performance from its leading fund. Man Group said the net asset value of its key AHL fund fell 8 percent last week. Mans shares closed down 0.9 percent.

title: Buyout Firms Circle Unit of German Drugmaker Merck
description: Private equity bidders are reportedly lining up to do battle over the generics business of Germanys Merck, said to be worth at least 4 billion euros ($5.3 billion). The Financial Times Deutschland reported that Bain Capital and Apax Partners are preparing a joint bid for the business, as are Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and Warburg Pincus. The Carlyle Group is also reportedly mulling a bid.

title: Mixed Results for Hedge Funds in February
description: Most hedge funds made money in February but some trend-following strategies and managers focused on the financial-services sector were hit by the sharp market sell-off late last month, Hedge Fund Research, a firm that tracks industry performance, said on Wednesday. Hedge funds returned 0.65 percent on average in February as gains from earlier in the month helped offset the effect of sharp stock market declines on Feb. 27, according to early calculations from the firm. About a quarter of the managers the research group tracks have reported February results.

title: Delphi to Raise $2 Billion in Share Sale
description: The auto-parts maker Delphi said Wednesday that it would issue almost $2 billion worth of common stock to existing shareholders as a step toward providing funds to emerge from bankruptcy. Delphi is offering current stock holders the right to buy 56,700,000 shares at $35 each, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Outside the Arc
description: The three-point arc in college basketball is 19 feet and nine inches away from the basket and there is growing pressure to move it back because players are getting so good at hitting the long shots.

title: Hair Line Recedes, Then Irish Move Forward
description: The Notre Dame assistant coach Rod Balanis was flipping channels this year when he stumbled across the AHL All-Star game and a reminder of just how different a year this is for the Irish basketball program.

title: Clearwire Raises $600 Million in I.P.O.
description: Clearwire, the wireless broadband company founded by the cellphone pioneer Craig O. McCaw, raised $600 million late Wednesday in its initial public offering, which priced at the top end of the expected range. Shares of the company, whose backers include Motorola and Intel, begin trading Thursday.

title: Tel Aviv's Manhattan Makeover
description: With a recent surge of New York-style residential projects, Tel Aviv's high-end real estate market has arrived.

title: At My Back
description: I did a nice job on the bottle of Alsatian wine that Bernard Alloux gave me at Christmas, left at my Paris hotel until the time seemed right to open it. At 1 a.m., Tuesday, the time was unquestionably right. I had written the last word I was going to write on the collections. Anyway, as the late great Amy Spindler, my predecessor, used to say about this tender moment in the cycle of a fashion writers life, Youre not really writing at the end, youre just vomiting.

title: Poles to the Polls in Northern Ireland
description: Theyre counting votes today in Northern Ireland for a new assembly that might soon actually meet and govern the province, nearly nine years after the terms for power-sharing local government were set out in the Good Friday Agreement. As Sarah Lyall and Eamon Quinn write in The Times,

title: Win a Trip With Nick Kristof
description: Would you like to travel with the Op-Ed columnist on a reporting trip to Africa?

title: Easters Coming, Prepare for War
description: Tobin Harshaw

title: 2008: Wall Street Primary
description: Perhaps taking a cue from labor unions, Bear Stearns is inviting the presidential candidates to make their pitches to the investment firms top bankers in New York. The Wall Street Journal reports:

title: Perella Weinberg Hires University Fund Manager
description: Perella Weinberg Partners has lined up another high-profile recruit. The boutique investment bank, founded less than a year ago by the veteran investment banker Joseph Perella, is hiring Robert Boldt, who managed the $19 billion endowment of the University of Texas. Mr. Boldt is expected to start a new fund at Perella Weinberg based on a model he used at the University of Texas Investment Management Company, The New York Times reported, citing undisclosed sources.

title: Studio System
description: The golden age of the Hollywood player (Armani, anyone?) meets the golden age of the Hollywood star.

title: The Gutting of CompUSA
description: Did you hear? In the next couple of months, CompUSA will be closing over half of its 225 stores.

title: Potholes Ahead for Americas Mayor
description: Is the honeymoon over for Rudy Giuliani? Sure, some new polls show him with a sizeable lead over his Republican presidential primary and potential general election opponents. But in the wake of last weeks Conservative Polical Action Conference funfest, and given the provocative story in The New York Times today, questioning whether he is too New York for breadbasket voters, bloggers are beginning wonder whether right-wing Republicans will be able to overlook his socially liberal positions.

title: War at Home: Eyes on 2008
description: New details about the length and scope of the Iraq troop buildup come out just as Democratic leaders prepare to unveil their new compromise legislation.

title: The Gleam Team
description: Go for the gold silver and bronze.

title: Lone Wolf
description: For the urban iconoclast, distressed threads and piled-on man jewels.

title: The Low-Fat Diet Flunks Another Test
description: The federal government has determined that a low-fat diet is beneficial to your health. Thats why its been advising Americans for so long to cut back on fats. But scientists are obstinately refusing to get with the program.

title: Catalina Checks Out with ValueAct for $1.6 Billion
description: Catalina Marketing, which had been on the auction block since December, agreed Thursday to a revised $1.6 billion all-cash offer from ValueAct Capital. The $32.10-a-share bid by ValueAct, a hedge fund, represents a 32 percent premium over Catalinas stock price of $24.23 on Dec. 7, the day before an unnamed private equity firm first emerged as a potential suitor.

title: Home Sweet Home
description: While driving across the state last night, I resisted the urge to stop in Labelle  where annual swamp cabbage festival  was held a few weekends ago. No visit to Labelle would be complete without a visit to the swamp cabbage festival.

title: One House, Four Floors and Nine Lives Lost
Activist Fund Steps Down from New Centurys Board
description: Amid an implosion in the subprime mortgage market, David Einhorn is resigning from the board of New Century Financial. The hedge fund manager, who runs Greenlight Capital, is leaving the company as it faces an inquiry into its accounting and mounting credit problems. The company made Mr. Einhorn a director last March after Greenlight Capital, a $4.7 billion fund and New Centurys second-largest shareholder, threatened to wage a proxy fight.

title: Injury Update
description: Just checked in with the Mike Sheridan, the Villanova sports information director, for an update on the injured guards Mike Nardi and Reggie Redding. Nardi played just two minutes yesterday because of a strained calf muscle and a sprained left ankle. Sheridan said that Nardi is not expected to start. Redding appeared to injure his ankle after hitting a swooping layup with about two minutes remaining in Novas victory over DePaul. Redding walked gingerly off the court but did return to the game. Sheridan called Redding the better of the two and said he expects him to play.

title: Conservapedia: The Word Says It All
description: Yes, really. As Wired News, The Guardian and CQPolitics, here on nytimes.com have reported, some conservatives have given up on Wikipedia and set about building an alternative online encyclopedia they can call their own: Conservapedia.

title: The Gutting of CompUSA
description: Did you hear? In the next couple of months, CompUSA will be closing over half of its 225 stores.

title: Raises and Judicial Impartiality
description: New York judges cannot refuse to hear cases in which clients are represented by lawyers who happen to be legislators, just because the judges are involved in a dispute withe legislature over pay raises, a state ethics panel says.

title: Hot Hoyas
description: Its starting to look like Villanova will be back in Philly in time for dinner. The Wildcats fell behind 14-0 to start the game and now trail 22-2. The Villanova Coach Jay Wright has picked up a frustration technical foul in an attempt to get his team motivated.

title: The Mayor on the Fire
description: The city room of The Times has mobilized a large team of editors, reporters, photographers and others who have been updating the comprehensive report on the fatal fire last night in the Bronx that killed eight children and an adult.

title: On the Block? Blog Network Says No
description: Its in the media business, but Federated Media Publishing is sending some surprisingly garbled messages. Jacob Weisberger, the chief operating officer of the blog-advertising network, seems to have spoken at length with MergerMarket about what a great acquisition his company would make for some savvy buyer and about how the company is seeking financing. After the contents of MergerMarkets client-only report made its way to the TechCrunch blog, however, Federated chief John Battelle followed up by saying his company was not for sale and was not in need of fresh capital.

title: Grand Tanyon*
description: One of the little joys of being a beat writer is going over to the other clubhouse to see players you used to cover. Once theyre on other teams, they often seem to look at you as something approaching an old friend  a person who, at least on some level, shared the same experiences and knew the same people for a while.

title: An Afternoon Snoozer
description: Even Patrick Ewing looked bored. Thats the best way to sum up the first half of the snoozer between Georgetown and Villanova. Ewing, on hand to watch his son play for the Hoyas,looked ready to doze off in the Madison Square Garden seats.

title: The Iraq War Is Not Taking Place
description: The French philosopher and critic Jean Baudrillard, who died this week, famously claimed that the gulf war did not take place. As Patricia Cohen explained in his obituary in The New York Times,

title: Was YouTube Worth It?
description: A tidbit in a regulatory filing late last week revealed that Google paid a whopping 100 times revenues for the video-sharing Web site YouTube. Perhaps more remarkable than the sticker shock, however, was the rhetoric employed by Googles chief executive, Eric Schmidt, to justify the deal. If you can build a sustainable eyeball business, you can always find clever ways to monetize it, Mr. Schmidt told a group of investors Tuesday.

title: Mountain West Opens in the Desert
description: The Mountain West Conference mens tournament is about to open (not counting Tuesday nights play-in game) the way most conference tournaments open: In the middle of a weekday, in front of a smattering of fans. Top-seeded Brigham Young faces eighth-seeded Texas Christian.

title: Imagining a Hedge-Less Greenwich
description: Picture this: A caravan of moving vans and Mercedes streaming out of Greenwich, Conn., is the forlorn occupants sing Fairfield County to the tune of Anatevka from Fiddler on the Roof. That is what came to mind when we read one Connecticut lawmakers reaction to a bill in the state legislature that would regulate hedge funds more closely. The legislator suggested it could cause a diaspora of fund managers, all looking for a new land free of oppression. The hedge fund industry would, by and large, pick up and leave the state, John McKinney, a Republican and minority leader of the state Senate, told the Greenwich Time.

title: Movie Minutes: '300'
description: The New York Times Chief Movie Critic A. O. Scott reviews "300," adapted from the Frank Miller graphic novel.

title: Movie Minutes: 'Angels'
description: The New York Times Chief Movie Critic A.O. Scott reviews "Exterminating Angels," an explicit French art house film.

title: A Swish and a Push
description: Georgetowns victory had long been determined at Madison Square Garden in the Hoyas noon tilt with Villanova. So why was their such a loud reaction from the crowd when Villanovas Curtis Sumpter hit a 3-pointer as time expired to make the final score 62-57?

title: CVS Raises Payout to Sweeten Caremark Bid
description: Less than a day after its rival bidder was dealt a pair of setbacks, CVS raised its offer to buy Caremark Rx, a company that manages drug benefits on behalf of corporations, unions and government agencies. CVS, a drugstore chain, said Thursday afternoon that it would increase the special dividend, payable to shareholders immediately after a merger closes, to $7.50 per share from $6 per share. The latest bid, which CVS called its best and final offer, seemed designed to deliver a death blow to a competiting proposal from Express Scripts, another drug-benefits manager.

title: Whistling in the Garden
description: The omnipresent official Tim Higgins best summed up the first half of Notre Dames game with Syracuse in the quarterfinals of the Big East tournament today. Higgins stopped by press row to announce: When youre working at 2:30, youre having a good day.

title: Too Little, Too Late?
description: Readers respond to David Brookss Mar. 8 column, Yes, Those Were the Days.

title: It Can Happen to Us
description: Readers respond to Bob Herberts Mar. 8 column, Lift the Curtain.

title: Clinton: Bush Cant Run a 2-Car Parade
description: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed new benefits and medical support this afternoon for military service members and their families, while also accusing the Bush administration of forcing a false choice between the needs of soldiers and veterans from Iraq and Afghanistan and the broader needs of all veterans.

title: Eugene Calls for 2nd Brooklyn Election
description: Barely an hour after he was certified as winner of a City Council election in Brooklyn, Mathieu Eugene held a press conference this afternoon saying that he was calling upon the City Council speaker and Mayor Bloomberg to order another special election.

title: A Familiar Cougar
description: The name on the back of the jersey is the same, and when he led a fastbreak and slipped a no-look pass to a teammate for an open look, you could be excused for the flashback. Brigham Youngs point guard is Austin Ainge, the son of Danny, the former Brigham Young All-American and N.B.A. All-Star, now struggling to build the Boston Celtics as their director of basketball operations.

title: Familiar Foes  Who Is the Favorite?
description: With a No. 3 seed and a 25-6 record, the Pittsburgh Panthers should be slightly favored over the Marquette Golden Eagles tonight when they meet in the quarter-finals of the Big East tournament.

title: Country-Fried Victory
description: Drinking a diet Sunkist, country singer and diehard Oklahoma fan Toby Keith sat on press row during Thursdays Oklahoma-Iowa State game in the first round of the Big 12 tournament at the Ford Center here in Oklahoma City.

title: Win a Trip With Nick Kristof
description: Would you like to travel with the Op-Ed columnist on a reporting trip to Africa?

title: Spam, Fraud and Pink Sheets
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended trading in 35 companies whose total net worth, I would bet, does not exceed the value of the computer you are reading this on. Not that it will be easy to figure that out, since they do not file financial statements with the commission.

title: Yanks win as Phillips returns to team
description: Heres the obligatory (and obvious) disclaimer: spring training numbers can be deceiving. Half the players on the field might be headed for the minors. But theyre all we have to go on this time of year.

title: Secrets of History: The C.I.A. in Iran
description: Now we pause briefly to read in and, hopefully, get a bit firmer grasp on just how we got to this point in our relations with the nation and people of Iran.

title: A Pokey Start for Air Force
description: Air Force and Wyoming have always had an interesting rivalry, largely because of how different their fan bases are. At the Mountain West tournament, Air Force fans, clad in blue, are a buttoned-up group. Wyoming fans, dressed in the brown and yellow of the schools colors, are not. At least one fan here does not have a shirt to button at all  a guy wearing nothing but cowboy boots, a cowboy hat and a hollowed-out gold keg around his midsection, kept in place by suspenders.

title: Blogtalk: War and Parking Tickets
description: In a press conference today, Gen. David H. Petraeus, the new American commander in Iraq, said that the fight in Iraq could go on longer than had been expected, while Congressional Democrats called for a binding resolution for the complete withdrawal from Iraq by 2008. The blogs tackled both issues.

title: Giuliani Mends Fences With Bratton
description: They made for successful but jealous partners, a pair of outsized talents and egos whose relationship crumbled more than a decade ago in a series of public spats.

title: More Debate Over Nevada and Netroots
description: Well, word is getting around that the Congressional Black Caucus Institute may be pairing up with Fox News for other primary debates and that it could be announced later this week.

title: A Testy Bloomberg in Miami
description: This afternooon, speaking to reporters in Miami, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg defended his decision to go ahead with his previously scheduled trip there, hours after one of the deadliest fires in New York Citys recent history. He grew irritated with some of the questions, refusing to say when he would return north.

title: Leaving College Basketball for the Drive Thru?
description: During the post-game handshake after fifth-seeded Texas Techs 81-71 victory over twelfth-seeded Colorado in the first round of the Big 12 tournament Thursday, Red Raiders Coach Bob Knight spoke for nearly 30 seconds at halfcourt with Buffaloes Coach Ricardo Patton.

title: Mayor Is Flying Home After All
description: In an abrupt change, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg now plans a quick return from Miami.

title: Violent Crime in Cities Shows Sharp Surge, Reversing Trend
