description: EPIPHANIES are tough to summarize in words, and Alberto Friass spiritual revelation in the New Mexican desert is no exception.

title: Hong Kong Leader Is Re-elected
description: HONG KONG, Sunday, March 25  Donald Tsang was re-elected today by a wide margin as Hong Kongs chief executive, following a campaign that drew unexpected interest as the first contested election for the territorys top job since Britain returned it to China in 1997.

title: More People, More Stuff to Buy
description: THE arrival this summer of a Starbucks and a New York Sports Clubs fitness center will round off the amenities in a condominium that its creators are heralding as the first luxury doorman building to open its doors in Harlem Heights. In a neighborhood best known for restored brownstones, the 10-story 180-unit structure makes its presence felt.

title: Refunds of Taxes on Nonrefundable Tickets; Restrictions on Using Miles
description: As a frequent traveler on a budget, I sometimes forfeit the fare if I cannot use a nonrefundable ticket. My travel agent says that airlines should refund the tax I have paid. But British Airways tells me that the entire amount I paid is nonrefundable. Who is right, B.A. or my agent? Steve Chernysh, Preverenges, Switzerland.

title: A Blessing in Disguise
description: SHOCK tactics have their place, especially when the band is playing so loud that you have to scream to be heard. But what they gain in power and spectacle they often lose in subtlety and sophistication.

title: Perks and Perils of a Heavy Gavel
description: AFTER four years of one-party rule in Washington, Americans, not to mention the White House, got a fresh taste last week of life under a divided government. A Democratic Congress threatened subpoenas of White House officials and moved toward setting a deadline for withdrawing troops from Iraq. A defiant Republican president, for his part, had some withering denunciations for his Congressional critics.

title: Attention, Fashionistas: Sample Sales Are Expanding
description: A BRAND new Diane von Furstenberg string bikini for $70, a Baccarat crystal wine glass for $36 and a $10,000 Tourneau womans watch for $5,000. Herms ties for half off. Prices like these are enough to make even a savvy shopper do a double take.

title: Youve Earned a Vacation. But Dare You Take It?
description: AS winter draws to its slushy close and the piles of snow outside your window turn dirty gray, sunny getaways start to seem almost unbearably tempting. Your daydreams fill with visions of islands rimmed by long, sandy beaches, or that adventure trip to Costa Rica, or the Disneyland trip you promised the kids.

title: The Event and the Image, Fused by the Viewfinder
description: PARIS

title: Kristin Abely, Thomas Dolan
description: Kristin Marie Abely and Thomas Vincent Dolan were married yesterday at Holy Trinity Church in Manhattan. The Rev. Kenneth J. Boller, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Witnesses Missing in Coachs Death
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, March 25  The Jamaican police said today that their investigation into the death of Bob Woolmer, the Pakistani cricket coach killed a week ago after his team lost a critical World Cup match, was complicated by the fact that many potential witnesses had already left Jamaica.

title: Marking Unions 50th, Europe Is Anxious on Future
description: BERLIN, March 25  Fifty years after its foundation was set in Rome as a trading bloc for six countries, the European Union marked a midlife milestone here today with all-night parties, a laid-back street festival and a fervent plea for renewal by the German chancellor, Angela Merkel.

title: Madrid Is the Spanish Major
description: Once the dowdy sister of stylish Barcelona, Madrid has at last emerged as Spain's coolest city. It may seem tied to tradition  all those Goyas and ornate gardens  but the city is also brimming with cutting-edge design and cuisine. And that's just before midnight, when the party really gets going.

title: So Many Hopefuls, So Few Puppets
description: TONIGHT, on the finale of NBCs  Grease: Youre the One That I Want, television viewers votes will determine which of four semifinalists will land the two leading roles (thats Sandy and Danny) in this summers Broadway revival of that 1972 musical.

title: As Our Open Space Gets Gobbled Up; For Well-Adjusted Dogs, a Place to Run Free (3 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: C.I.A. Awaits Rules on Terrorism Interrogations
description: WASHINGTON, March 24  A sharp debate within the Bush administration over the future of the Central Intelligence Agencys detention and interrogation program has left the agency without the authority to use harsh interrogation techniques that the White House said last fall were necessary in questioning terrorism suspects, according to administration and Congressional officials.

title: Russian Police Trample Anti-Putin Protest
description: NIZHNY NOVGOROD, Russia, March 24  Riot police officers swarmed on a group of several dozen journalists and demonstrators on Saturday in Nizhny Novgorod, Russias third-largest city, cutting off a protest against the government of President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Barkley, Once a Boxing King, Now Has a One-Bedroom Kingdom
description: They say you cant go home again, but Iran Barkley said he had little choice.

title: Letters
description: A New Star in the Kitchen

title: 36 Hours in Prague
description: FORGET all thoughts of Kafka, post-communist grit and writers trying to craft the Great American Novel, as most of the old ideas about Prague are now very far off the mark. Instead, expect a modern, extremely liveable city that is among the most Western (both literally and figuratively) of all the former Communist-bloc capitals, where long-held myths about Eastern Europe are exploded on a daily basis. The cosmopolitan Czech capital is home to better restaurants than you might find in many American cities, and a new generation of designers and style-conscious shoppers are helping shake off the drabness  and the misconceptions  of the past. Fortunately, the Gothic spires, cobblestone lanes, bridges and the supermodel-prone locals are all still gorgeous.

title: Jillana Rosenberg, Gary Valente
description: Jillana Beth Rosenberg and Gary Vincent Valente were married last evening at the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park in New York. Raymond A. Sanseverino, a nondenominational minister, officiated.

title: Robin Gonzalez and Alec Decker
description: WHEN Robin Gonzalez, a massage therapist and yoga instructor, told friends she was dating someone in the Army, they thought it was an unlikely match.

title: Service Bulletins Help Plug the Leaks
description: TECHNICAL service bulletins, or T.S.B.s, offer insights from automakers into some recurring problems, often providing solutions for hard-to-trace car ailments. The bulletins are not recalls; they are notices provided by manufacturers to mechanics and the service departments of their dealers.

title: Sweet Chastity
description: Hanne Blank knows her erotica. The author of Virgin: The Untouched History is also the author of Unruly Appetites, a collection of erotic stories, and the editor or co-editor of several other books, including Shameless: Womens Intimate Erotica, Best Transgender Erotica and Zaftig: Well-Rounded Erotica. Given this background, I was expecting a pretty juicy book.

title: In a Coffee-Mad City, the Bitter With the Sweet
description: IN Rio de Janeiro, every street corner offers an opportunity for refreshment: juice bars, aa stands, open-air bars and of course botequins. These neighborhood institutions are part caf, part lunch counter and part bistro; the place for a quick salgadinho, one of the salty snacks like fried balls of salt cod, and a cafezinho, the little cup of coffee beloved by Brazilians.

title: A Better Society? Or a Better Rsum?
description: Ah, Naomi.

title: Out on the Tightrope, Where Comics Try Acting
description: THE idea of Adam Sandler playing a 9/11 widower is off-putting in so many ways: Theres the hint of exploitation in the premise itself, along with a plot that announces its Life or Death theme, and the usually cringe-inducing spectacle of a comedian reaching for tragedy.

title: Christiane Gallois, Stephen Klein
description: Christiane Franchi Gallois and Stephen Dale Klein are to be married in a civil ceremony today at their country home in Spinnerstown, Pa. Mayor Albert Haynes of Trumbauersville, Pa., is to officiate. Next Saturday the couple is to have a nondenominational public ceremony at the Txai Resort in Itacar, Brazil.

title: A Developer Picks Up Where Others Leave Off
description: WHILE some other developers may be having second thoughts about New York Citys residential real estate market, Larry Korman seems to be making himself at home there.

title: Street News
description: In 1992, 15-year-old Leon Michael Stanton stabbed a veteran and double amputee, Harold Charboneau, 42, in the bedroom of his ranch house in Portland, Ore. Stanton left his victim in a pool of blood and went to the kitchen to see what was in the refrigerator. When he came back, Charboneau was still alive. Stanton stabbed him some more and asked how it felt. It feels so cold, Charboneau said.

title: Will Diners Still Swallow This?
description: CARROLLTON, Tex.

title: Theaters Alive With the Sound of Laptops
description: AMONG the uncommon pleasures of the 2003 Broadway revival of Wonderful Town was that you could actually see the orchestra, arrayed like a decorative garland of brass and polished wood across an onstage bridge. Another was that there was enough of an orchestra to be worth seeing. Nearly matching the original 1953 instrumentation, the shows producers sprang for a hefty complement of 24 musicians. At least at first.

title: Dogs at the Office: Not Always So Cute
description: I HAVE gotten a most unusual rush of mail since my last column  photographs of Katie the wheaten terrier, Olive the Jack Russell terrier, Harley the toy poodle, and Nukka and Brody, who appear to be border collies and who seem to be sharing an office cubicle with a python who looks to be in the midst of digesting what I can only hope is not a colleagues pet.

title: The Sophisticated Traveler: Popping Wheelies
description: Luggage with wheels and luggage with style need not be mutually exclusive. Joining high-design trolleys from makers like Prada, Louis Vuitton and Brunello Cucinelli (love that cashmere lining), Alexander McQueens new Hero collection for Samsonite is making chic roll. It includes two wheeled suitcases, one in fake croc, the other imprinted with what resembles a human rib cage (pictured), both available in black and white ($750). Go to www.samsonite.com.

title: Classical Context; Downloading Films; Clyfford Still
description: CLASSICAL CONTEXT

title: Shadows of Watts, in the Light
description: BURBANK, Calif.

title: Julie Kern, Ian Wilkofsky
description: Julie Harriet Kern and Ian Geoff Wilkofsky were married last evening at the Four Seasons Resort and Club in Irving, Tex. Rabbi William G. Gershon officiated.

title: Lauren Schachter, Barry Janay
description: Lauren Beth Schachter, a daughter of Deborah Chase Schachter and Dr. Neil Schachter of New York, was married last evening to Barry Eran Janay, a son of Marlene Janay and Gad Janay of Boca Raton, Fla. Rabbi David J. Gelfand officiated at the Yale Club of New York City.

title: Paper Barriers to Care (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: My Landlord Likes Lenin
description: ONE morning last week, a tired-looking businessman named Richard Du was pacing around the partly renovated space that would soon house Dumann Realty, his commercial real estate brokerage.

title: Laugh Lines: Jay Leno and Conan OBrien
description: JAY LENO

title: Wingmen in the Wings
description: STANDING in the Belmont Lounge near Union Square the other night, a lime wedged in the neck of his Corona, Art Malov posed a question to the 15 men around him. How many of you have been in a situation where youve seen a beautiful woman and didnt have anything to say?

title: Ciao, Urbino
description: ALTHOUGH its barely 200 pages long, Natalie Danfords first novel has enough plot for several books. On the one hand, its the rags-to-riches tale of an immigrant who comes to America to escape a dark secret, is cheated and scorned, yet eventually rises from the rank of janitor to attain the pinnacle of American success, a house in the suburbs. On the other, its the sensual odyssey of a young woman in Italy, complete with liberal helpings of butter and carbs, the reckless driving of a Fiat, and sex with a former thief. Its also a mystery involving an old key, hidden at the back of a drawer. And its a story about the Holocaust.

title: Real-Time Pricing for Electricity; Opening Waterways for Recreation; Kindly Souls All Over Town (3 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Fitting in on Campus
description: NEW ROCHELLE

title: Army Corps Reform (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Hong Kong Leader Wins Re-election by an Expected Wide Margin
description: HONG KONG, Sunday, March 25  Donald Tsang was re-elected Hong Kongs chief executive by a wide margin on Sunday, following a campaign that drew unexpected interest as the first contested election in the territorys history.

title: Missing
description: Although Granta has just named him one of the best young American novelists under the age of 35, Daniel Alarcn makes me think not of a novelist but of the late Polish journalist Ryszard Kapuscinski. Alarcn shares Kapuscinskis candor and eye for detail, and his ambitious book, Lost City Radio  about the vacuum war creates in the lives of those who survive it  almost feels like a response to an argument Kapuscinski once made: There can be a thousand topics. But in the end there will only be one: reminiscences from the war.

title: Corrections
description: Editors Notes

title: Stacy Meyer, Bret Danow
description: Stacy Robyn Meyer, the daughter of Rene Meyer of White Plains, was married last evening to Bret Jonathan Danow, the son of Susan and Steven Danow of Pomona, N.Y. Rabbi Craig Scheff officiated at the Hilton Pearl River in Pearl River, N.Y.

title: New Translation Prompts Debate on Islamic Verse
description: CHICAGO  Laleh Bakhtiar had already spent two years working on an English translation of the Koran when she came upon Chapter 4, Verse 34.

title: A Comfy Perch for Watching Speeders
description: The loudest party in Europe each year, and some say the wildest, happens in late May, when thousands of motor racing fans head to Monaco for the Grand Prix (May 27 this year). What makes this Formula One event popular is that it is not your typical speedway race and it does not attract your average gearhead. Rather, the race takes place in the narrow, winding city streets of Monaco  making it possible for viewers to watch every twist and turn from the relative quiet of various hotel balconies (right).

title: States Praise Reading Program Despite Its Troubles, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON, March 24  Despite irregularities in the management of Reading First, President Bushs initiative to teach reading to low-income children, a majority of states credit the program with improving reading instruction, according to a report by the Government Accountability Office released Friday.

title: Sheffield Tenants Win a Round
description: AS some of the largest luxury rental buildings in Manhattan began converting to condominiums in the last few years, the tenants paying market rates  up to $3,500 or more  faced a tough choice: fight their landlords for the right to stay as renters or move on when their leases expired.

title: Baja Bottled
description: On a trip to sample mezcal in Oaxaca three years ago I encountered a restaurateur who kept imploring me to try his house wines, produced by a friend in Baja. I managed to stave him off for a week, indulging in Negra Modelos instead, until the last night, when he uncorked two bottles of red and I was made to walk the plank. The water, it turned out, was shockingly fine. After sampling a complex, silky cabernet-merlot and then a jamlike tempranillo-garnacha blend, I had to pick my jaw off the ground. Why werent these available, or even known, in the States? He laughed proudly and said: Theres very little and we drink them all here, and happily. What do we need to send them north for?

title: Comings and Goings
description: Spruce Peak at Stowe, the Vermont ski destinations new base-area development, is the first mountain resort in the country to have earned the Audubon Green Community Award from Audubon International. Some of the propertys practices include protecting more than 2,000 acres of wildlife habitat; financial support of the Stowe Municipal trolley system and bike path; and a transfer gondola that eliminates the need for bus transfers (www.livestowe.com). ... Campers and road-trippers looking for an environmentally friendly, fast and easy way to wash clothes might want to visit www.laundry-alternative.com, which is selling a mechanism called the Wonderwash. It is compact (12 by 12 by 16 inches), requires no electricity and uses 90 percent less water and detergent than a conventional washing machine. The Wonderwash, which costs $42.95, uses a hand-cranked pressure system that can wash five pounds of clothing in a few minutes. ... Travelers visiting Charleston, S.C., for the Spoleto Festival will also be able to enjoy a new exhibition at the Gibbes Museum of Art, Rodin: In His Own Words: Selections from the Iris & B. Gerald Cantor Foundation, on view May 25 through Aug. 12. The exhibition, which features about 30 original bronze casts of Auguste Rodins sculptures, including Venus (left), also includes written works by the artist (www.gibbesmuseum.org). ... Norwegian Coastal Voyage Escorted Vacations is offering a 16-day trip, Scandinavian Smorgasbord, which goes by train, bus and cruise from Stockholm, to Copenhagen, Oslo, Lapland and the Lofoten Islands. Prices are $5,369 to $6,709 a person, double occupancy, and include airfare from New York, most meals and first-class hotels. There is a discount of up to $275 a person for booking by March 31. Trips are available from June 21 to Sept. 14. Go to www.norwegiancoastalvoyage.us and click on Vacations.

title: To Bolster Control, Porsche Will Make Bid for Volkswagen
description: BERLIN, March 24  The German sports-car maker Porsche said Saturday that it would make a takeover bid for Volkswagen, a symbolically audacious but largely legal step in its growing control over VW, Europes largest carmaker and the inventor of the once-ubiquitous Beetle.

title: Rice Pursues Shuttle Diplomacy in Mideast
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank, March 25  American, Israeli and Arab officials continued their crawl toward Mideast peace negotiations on Sunday. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice prodded the Israeli and Palestinian leaders to agree at least to negotiating objectives, while Egyptian officials said that they were waiting for Israel to make the next move.

title: Plan to Move Family Y Is Drawing Opposition
description: Westport

title: Correction: Grown Up, Cleaned Up and Back in the Game
description: An article last Sunday about Tatum ONeal and her forthcoming roles, including one on the television show Rescue Me, misstated the number of seasons the series has been on the air. In June, it will be starting its fourth season, not its third.

title: Calendar of Events
description: FILM

title: Revealing All Before Anyone Else Can
description: WASHINGTON

title: If We Met in a Former Life, Maybe He Was Straight Then
description: Hes gay, you know, Bonnie said.

title: From Three Artists, an Islands History and Botany
description: Paintings of lush, juicy tropical fruits abound in Mi Puerto Rico: Master Painters of the Island, 1780-1952, the Newark Museums marvelous exhibition sampling the work of three of the islands great painters from different generations: Jos Campeche (1751-1809), Francisco Oller (1833-1917) and Miguel Pou (1880-1968). There are landscapes, portraits and religious paintings, too, but the still lifes of fruit really lure the viewer.

title: Billboard Blues
description: AS it turned out, the legal artwork was also the riskiest.

title: Rustic Roots, Sprouting Enduring Truths From a Century Ago
description: WEST PARK, N.Y.

title: Taking on Role of Top Advocate, and Eager for Stability
description: TRENTON

title: Candidates Outline Ideas for Universal Health Care
description: LAS VEGAS, March 24  Seven Democratic candidates for president promised Saturday to guarantee health insurance for all, but they disagreed over how to pay for it and how fast it could be achieved.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Lottery Numbers

title: Samples Are In; Results Are Mainly Negative
Calendar of Events
description: Music and Dance

title: Slow Down, Brave Multitasker, and Dont Read This in Traffic
description: Confident multitaskers of the world, could I have your attention?

title: Howard Ronson, 63, Builder of Towers, Dies
description: Howard P. Ronson, a British real estate developer who in the 1980s became one of the most prolific builders of office space in Manhattan, died Wednesday near his home in Monaco. He was 63.

title: Reds That Belie North Fork Roots
description: Tasted blind, the five related Raphael reds I sampled recently would come across as Bordeaux, not North Fork. One, Raphaels latest cabernet franc, has glimmerings of potential greatness.

title: Letters
description: The Brain on the Stand

title: Where the Action Is, Two Recent Deaths
description: LITTLE was left to chance when Mototown USA in Windsor opened in September. The 350,000-square-foot stadium  which bills itself as the largest indoor motocross center in the world  has two motocross tracks, for children and adults, and a third for go-cart racing  all surrounded by walls specially designed to absorb the roar of the engines and a powerful ventilation system to remove harmful exhaust and make breathing easier for riders and spectators.

title: Spring Bulbs
description: O.K., so those corkscrewy compact fluorescent light bulbs cost a lot  up to eight times more than regular incandescent bulbs. They can buzz annoyingly and cast a pallid light that many people find icky. But in other respects they are amazingly easy to love. They use about 75 percent less electricity than ordinary bulbs and can last 10 times longer. Just one bulb can save its owner $30 or more over its long, virtuous life. Thinking globally, its possible to imagine billions of bulbs saving billions of dollars and countless kilowatts, thus vastly reducing the burning of coal and the production of planet-warming carbon dioxide.

title: Preservationists Rallying Cry
description: When preservationists in Greenwich Village were pushing in 2003 for landmark protection for the meatpacking district, they noticed something strange. Several building owners had suddenly asked for permits to modify their properties, knowing, perhaps, that even if the buildings became landmarks, they could still alter them if they already had the permits.

title: Clicking Delete, Without Looking
description: SENDING an e-mail message is one of the more spontaneous things you can do in modern life, but maybe spontaneous is not great.

title: Amy Lefko and Ross Levy
description: Amy Lefko, a daughter of Rosalind Lefko of Las Vegas and the late Arnold Lefko, is to be married this afternoon to Ross M. Levy, the son of Susan K. Levy and George M. Levy of Newburgh, N.Y. Rabbi Lance Sussman will perform the ceremony at Reform Congregation Keneseth Israel in Elkins Park, Pa., with Cantor Jonathan Comisar participating.

title: Victory Never Smelled Worse
description: LAS VEGAS

title: Northern Ireland Government Plans Hit Snag
description: LONDON, March 24  Northern Irelands biggest Protestant party, led by the Rev. Ian Paisley, balked Saturday at joining a government with the provinces Roman Catholics, only two days before a deadline to restore a power-sharing local government in Belfast.

title: No Highway to Heaven
description: The recent rejection of a proposed bill to build the Super 7 highway between Norwalk and Danbury is a blow to advocates fighting for the expressway and to commuters who have the misfortune to crawl along in the traffic jams that plague the current Route 7.

title: If You Go to Hong Kong
description: The Ngong Ping 360 cable car (852-2109-9898; www.np360.com.hk) runs Monday through Friday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., and Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. It departs from the Tung Chung Town Centre terminal and Ngong Ping Plateau terminal. A package deal that includes a round-trip cable-car ride plus the Walking with Buddha exhibit and Monkeys Tale Theater costs 145 Hong Kong dollars for an adult and 75 dollars for a child (about $18 and $9.40, respectively, at the rate of 7.97 Hong Kong dollars to one United States dollar).

title: Connecticut Closes Wolfpacks Stirring Run
description: FRESNO, Calif., March 24  North Carolina States stirring run through the womens N.C.A.A. tournament, inspired by a battle against Stage 4 breast cancer by Coach Kay Yow, came to a premature end Saturday night. This time, there would be no career-high deliverance from one of the starters, no last-minute rescue, no magic in the pink shoelaces.

title: Taking to the Sky Above the City Crowds
description: WITH more tall buildings than New York City and more people per square mile than anywhere else on earth, Hong Kong  a tightly packed city of 6.9 million people  deserves its reputation as an Asian Manhattan.

title: The Danger in the Fine Print
description: IN New Yorks construction boom of the last few years, many people have been buying apartments in buildings before they actually rise out of the ground. The buyers cant see them, smell them or touch them. When they finally do, they are sometimes in for very big surprises, some of them infuriating.

title: 1966: David Eyres Pancake
description: Craig Claiborne described making the acquaintance of the oven-baked pancake as if he had met Grace Kelly: It was discovered some weeks ago at an informal Sunday brunch in the handsome, Japanese-style home of the David Eyres in Honolulu. With Diamond Head in the distance, a brilliant, palm-ringed sea below and this delicately flavored pancake before us, we seemed to have achieved paradise.

title: Dont Even Think About Saying Dont
description: RIVERHEAD, N.Y.

title: Georgetown Headed to Final Four
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., March 25  It was not for the national championship, but, 25 years later, North Carolina and Georgetown put together another game that will be remembered a generation from now.

title: The Presidents Prison
description: George Bush does not want to be rescued.

title: Tales From the Torrid Zone: Travels in the Deep Tropics
description: By Alexander Frater

title: Never Let Facts Interrupt a Good Rumor
description: TRENTON

title: Rhonda Quain, Gentry Klein
description: Rhonda Danielle Quain, a daughter of Cherie Flom Quain of Old Greenwich, Conn., and Mitchell Quain of New York was married yesterday to Gentry Scott Klein, a son of Elaine Klein and Jeffrey Myles Klein of Centereach, N.Y. Evelyn Burns, a marriage officer with the ministry of justice for Antigua and Barbuda, officiated at a civil ceremony at Harmony Hall, a restaurant in Antigua. Last evening, Dr. Leonard Flom of Fairfield, Conn., a grandfather of the bride and a member of Congregation Beth-El in Fairfield, performed a Jewish ceremony.

title: Greek Revival
description: The year 1950 was a grim one for Greece, as the countrys economy was reeling from the double blows of world war and civil strife. The government, though, was farsighted enough to recognize one opportunity: tourism. It built and ran a chain of hotels, called xenias, on some of the most picturesque sites in the country. Fast-forward half a century, and most of the 36 xenias  each masterminded by a Greek architect and built in a clean, Modernist style  had become run-down or even abandoned. Enter the architectural preservationist Pantelis Nikolakopoulos, who began a campaign to persuade the government to recognize the xenias cultural importance and renovate the best examples. Today his plan is bearing fruit, and two are running as swanky, retro-style hotels: the Mykonos Theoxenia (above, shown pre-renovation; 011-30-22890-22230; www.mykonostheoxenia.com; doubles from about $182), just behind the windmills on the jet-set islands harbor, and the xenia in the waterfront city of Volos (011-30-24210-92700; doubles from $185). Four more prime xenias (in Vytina, Skiathos, Thassos and Tsagarada) have been put up for sale, though firm takers have yet to emerge. Andre Balazs, are you listening?

title: The Washington Back Channel
description: I. So there I sat, watching the United States government in all its majesty dragging into court the American press (in all its piety), forcing reporters to betray confidences, rifling their files and notebooks, making them swear to their confused memories and motives and burdening their bosses with hefty legal fees  all for the high-sounding purpose, yet again, of protecting our nations secrets. Top-secret secrets! In wartime!

title: Correction: Review of Remainder
description: A review on Feb. 25 about Remainder, by Tom McCarthy, rendered incorrectly the name of the test that distinguishes androids from humans in Blade Runner, the 1982 science-fiction film based on a novel by Philip K. Dick, whose work was compared with McCarthys. In printed references to the film, it is Voight-Kampff, not void comp. (In Dicks novel Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? it is spelled Voigt-Kampff, without the h.)

title: Old-Time Staples and Sloppy Joes
description: Schooleys Mountain General Store in Schooleys Mountain is picture-perfect. With its tin ceiling and potbelly stove, this old-fashioned outpost in Morris County seems unchanged since 1830, when it first opened. Now, as then, you can stop by for groceries like milk and eggs or to mail a letter (the local post office is inside). But today the store also sells satisfying sandwiches.

title: For 2008: An American Themistocles
description: Leonidas led the Spartans at Thermopylae, and as anybody whos seen 300 can tell you, he had all the qualities of a perfect movie hero. He was brave, straightforward and self-sacrificing.

title: Team on the Run Is Facing an Opponent Noted for Its Stops
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., March 24  The first 2 points came on a tip-in basket by Marcus Ginyard. Like the start of any run, it did not seem particularly significant. North Carolina had merely knocked 2 points off a 10-point deficit to Southern California in the second half of Friday nights game.

title: Katharine Lampen, Daniel Sachar
description: Katharine Matson Lampen, a daughter of Susan Lampen and Richard Lampen of Coral Gables, Fla., was married last evening to Daniel Amos Sachar, the son of Eliana Steimatzky Sachar and Howard M. Sachar of Kensington, Md. Rabbi Terry Bookman officiated at the Four Seasons Hotel in Miami.

title: Letters
description: Not Pretty, Indeed

title: The Badder Good
description: Not long ago, in a pile of unopened mail, I came across a solicitation from a new organization that sends authors into New York City public schools. I found it bizarre, because I volunteer for a different organization that has been doing much the same for a long time. Then, a few days later, after donating money to one police-affiliated organization that solicited me by phone, I received a call from another one.

title: The Middle Ages
description: ITS official: middle schools are a mess. If you didnt already suspect this, a battery of standardized tests, some of which are required under the No Child Left Behind law, have confirmed that in rich and poor school districts alike, reading and math scores drop from fifth to sixth grade, when most students move to middle school. Whats worse is that the scores continue to decline through eighth grade, as do students self-esteem and engagement in school.

title: Can You Live With the Voices in Your Head?
description: Angelo, a London-born scientist in his early 30s with sandy brown hair, round wire-frame glasses and a slight, unobtrusive stammer, vividly recalls the day he began to hear voices. It was Jan. 7, 2001, and he had recently passed his Ph.D. oral exams in chemistry at an American university, where, for the previous four and a half years, he conducted research into infrared electromagnetism. Angelo was walking home from the laboratory when, all of a sudden, he heard two voices in his head. It was like hearing thoughts in my mind that were not mine, he explained recently. They identified themselves as Andrew and Oliver, two angels. In my minds eye, I could see an image of a bald, middle-aged man dressed in white against a white background. This, I was told, was Oliver. What the angels said, to Angelos horror, was that in the coming days, he would die of a brain hemorrhage. Terrified, Angelo hurried home and locked himself into his apartment. For three long days he waited out his fate, at which time his supervisor drove him to a local hospital, where Angelo was admitted to the psychiatric ward. It was his first time under psychiatric care. He had never heard voices before. His diagnosis was schizophrenia with depressive overtones.

title: Behind This Office Door, the Napping Chair
description: Southington

title: Rice Hints at U.S. Peace Push on Mideast
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Sunday, March 25  In making her fourth trip to the Middle East in four months to try to breathe life into dormant Israeli-Palestinian peace negotiations, Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice has opened the door to the possibility that the United States might offer its own proposals to bridge the divide on some of the entrenched issues that have bedeviled the region for decades.

title: When the Lullaby Is Broadway
description: A QUICK poll of a few producers and press agents around Broadway resulted in a near unanimous candidate for Worst Show Time of the Week. Herewith, a cautionary tale:

title: Where Expressway-Clogging Cars Meet Their Fate
description: MEDFORD

title: On One Tuesday Every Month, Top-Level Chess in Manhattan
description: In 2002, Gregory Shahade, an international master, started a weekly tournament called the New York Masters to have a place where very strong players could play against other very strong players on a regular basis. The tournaments, held at the Marshall Chess Club in Manhattan, often attracted a half-dozen grandmasters, many world-class.

title: In October, Maybe Fewer Deals on Wheels
description: IF a customer is trying to cut a bargain deal, the worst time to buy a new car or truck is a weekend day in October or November.

title: Shopping, Art and Fashion in Madrid
description: THREE SHOPPING STOPS

title: Betting Pointers
description: There are basic wagers that college basketball fans can make on N.C.A.A. tournament games.

title: Capricornucopia
description: Back in the 1960s, the British travel writer Alexander Frater wrote a series of stories for The New Yorker set on an imaginary tropical island he called Tofua. One day, a fact checker informed him that he had found the island on a map, deep in the South Pacific. But many years later, when Frater got a chance to compare the idyllic pastoral island of his stories with the real thing, the resemblance was about on the order of the manatees Columbus once mistook for mermaids.

title: Into the Mystical Unreal Reality of the Faroe Islands
description: In a small cafe in a town called Nolsoy, on an archipelago in the middle of the North Atlantic, surrounded by barflies and the blue fug of cigarette smoke, I am trying to be unobtrusive. This is not going so well. There are precisely two occupied tables in the establishment, the barflies and mine. At mine, English is spoken, pallid beer is sipped, and all eye contact is avoided. At theirs, they speak a derivative of Old Norse, drink a rigorous liquor and shoot glances my way, accompanied by throaty chuckles. I, in fact, look not only like an American and a tourist, but also like an idiot, having walked up onto the quayside at Nolsoy, through its most famous landmark  the bone archway formed by the massive jaws of a sperm whale  and into its one bar wearing a flotation suit. A giant, puffy, one-piece flotation suit. Ten minutes ago, thudding across freezing harbor waters in a Zodiac, a flotation suit had seemed like a good idea. Now it makes me look like a Power Ranger. The chuckles are starting to crescendo. As I exit the place, from behind me I hear, Zay hallo to George Bush.

title: Traveling the World, Without So Much as a Hall Pass
description: White Plains

title: On Patrol, and Now on Edge
description: The news has been dreadful for two weeks now, a steady rain of shootings and beatings and knifings and indictments for members of the nations largest police department. Even officers stoic by nature confess to being rattled.

title: Hilary Poris, Andrew Macklin
description: Hilary Sue Poris, the daughter of Carole Poris and Harvey M. Poris of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Andrew Ross Macklin, a son of Deborah M. Charles of South Orange, N.J., and a stepson of the late Dr. Seymour Charles. Rabbi Harvey Goldman officiated at the Crystal Plaza in Livingston, N.J.

title: Afternoon Flights Are for the Birds
description: DECEMBER is the cruelest month, if you were hoping your plane would arrive on time.

title: Superfluous Hospitals
description: Here is a tale that is hard to believe. A financially troubled state with more fiscal responsibilities than it can possibly meet is seriously considering spending millions of taxpayer dollars to bail out a money-strapped hospital in an area that already has too many hospitals.

title: Always a Bridesdude, Never a Bridegroom?
description: AT her wedding last August in San Clemente, Calif., Diane Huliganga Parriott had eight bridal attendants. Four wore coral-tone gowns. Four wore black tuxedos with matching coral handkerchiefs and coral flowers in their lapels.

title: French Winner, Clear and Dry
description: The most savory dry sauvignon blanc at a Loire Valley Wine Bureau tasting here two weeks ago was Christian Thirot-Fourniers 2005 Sancerre from Domaine des Vieux Pruniers. It stood out among 30 wines from seven appellations.

title: Corrections
description: A cabaret review yesterday of Marilyn Maye, who is singing tonight at 7:30 at the Metropolitan Room, 34 West 22nd Street, misstated the clubs telephone number. It is (212) 206-0440.

title: This Magic Moment
description: One night around 1960  about the time that songs he had written for the Drifters, Elvis Presley, and Dion and the Belmonts were all topping the charts  Doc Pomus was having dinner with his young protg, an ambitious oddball named Phil Spector. They were, as usual, at the Spindletop steakhouse, in the Hotel Forrest in Midtown Manhattan. Pomus was residing there and holding court nightly in the lobby.

title: The Price of a Word and the Pain It Causes
description: Lawrence Township

title: 2 Hurt in Crash Involving 5 Taxis
description: One taxicab crashed into another on a busy Midtown street yesterday, starting a domino effect that left five taxis damaged and sent two pedestrians to the hospital.

title: What Id Be Without You
description: Anna hates her mother. Well, of course she doesnt hate her, she loves her. But it can be hard to tell the difference. In Crete, where they have gone on a late-season holiday, Anna mentally clocks her mothers transgressions: flirting with a waiter, a driver and everything in trousers; drinking too much raki; jawing on about her friends back in Yarmouth, especially her affected old thesp boyfriend, Vernon, a retired ventriloquist. Everything her mother does irritates Anna.

title: Wanted: The Real Kid
description: That Billy the Kid actually existed may surprise many today  say, the viewers of The Simpsons. In 2002, the shows Halloween special depicted his corpse clawing out of his grave to lead a reign of terror at the head of the Hole in the Ground Gang, a zombie posse that included the Sundance Kid, Frank and Jesse James, and a squat carcass whom Billy introduced as the most evil German of all time ... Kaiser Wilhelm.

title: Russias Stages of Grief Begin and End With Acceptance
description: MOSCOW

title: Northeast Los Angeles: Ready for a Close-Up
description: LOS ANGELES

title: High-Born Homes That Came and Went
description: THE Greenwich Village Society for Historic Preservation has proposed enlarging the 1969 Greenwich Village Historic District, extending it south through half a dozen blocks of tenements, almost to Canal Street. Little on these blocks suggests they were once home to a distinguished residential neighborhood, of which the most prestigious address was Bleecker Street, known today for its clubs and cacophony.

title: The Week in Connecticut
description: Lawmakers Kill Super 7 Completion Proposal

title: Police Report
description: I am an emergency-medicine physician. The police and E.M.S. brought in a man in handcuffs who passed out while driving and hit a barrier. They thought he was drunk, which our alcohol test confirmed. But when he identified himself as an off-duty police officer, the cuffs were removed and no charges were filed. Can I report this without violating my ethical and legal duty to protect patient privacy?  name withheld, New York

title: The New New List
description: Washington, D.C. is the new Washington, D.C.

title: Alumni Are Fighting  to Save Rutgers Sports; Girls Just Want to Play Hockey; Revenge Delayed, but Sweet Indeed (3 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Sunlight, Online
description: It would be an important move toward open government. The New Jersey Legislature seems about to put the voting record of each state senator and Assembly member online. As things stand now, it is virtually impossible for the public to see in one-easy-to-find location how legislators voted on every measure before their house.

title: From Alien Boy to Growing Star in the Indie Universe
description: THE petit-gris snail is quite cunning, for a snail, but all too often it meets its end in garlic and parsley butter. Yet here is Joseph Gordon-Levitt  actor, Francophile and recent Columbia University dropout  rhapsodizing on the sacred geometry of the Helix aspersa Mller during lunch at a SoHo brasserie.

title: Correction: Can What You Know Affect What You Hear?
description: An article last Sunday about the ways knowledge of an artists background can affect listener perceptions misstated the academic affiliation of Denis Dutton, who has written on the topic. He teaches at the University of Canterbury, not Cambridge.

title: For Gonzales, More Records, and Questions
description: WASHINGTON, March 24  An accumulating body of evidence is at odds with the statements of Attorney General Alberto R. Gonzales that he played little role in the deliberations over the dismissal of eight United States attorneys.

title: Denise Lai, Marco Gomez
description: Denise G. Lai, the daughter of Gloria Y. Lai and Andy T. Lai of Bayside, Queens, was married yesterday to Marco Betancourt Gomez, a son of Nora Gomez and Rey Gomez of Whitestone, Queens. The Rev. Arthur G. Minichello, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Fidelis Church in College Point, Queens.

title: Lyrics: Im Handicapped by Bob Baker
Man Convicted in Incest Case Plans Appeal to Supreme Court
description: CINCINNATI, March 23  A man convicted of having sex with his 22-year-old stepdaughter is seeking to challenge Ohios incest law through an appeal to the United States Supreme Court.

title: Guns and Yoga
description: Not long ago, I decided to learn how to shoot guns. It was a Saturday morning, and I was curious. So after a breakfast of spelt flakes, soy milk and green tea, I went out shooting.

title: For Cats and Dogs, Life Is a Bowl of ...
description: What exactly are pet owners getting when they buy their pet food  some $16 billion worth each year in the United States?

title: Design for Living in Zlin, Czech Republic
description: Once people used to joke that this town wasnt in Central Europe at all  they used to call Zlin a piece of America, somehow misplaced here in the Czech Republic. On a dark, cold night, lugging my bag up to the incongruously huge, monolithically rectangular Hotel Moskva, it was hard to imagine why. But first impressions can be deceptive.

title: The Rush to Vaccinate
description: Washington

title: Yankees Wang to Start Season on Disabled List
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 24  The side effect of Chien-Ming Wangs hamstring injury, which will land him on the disabled list to start the season, is an idea so preposterous it seems hard to fathom: Carl Pavano could be the Yankees opening day starter April 2.

title: Straddling Liberalism and Conservatism
description: Larchmont

title: The Pacers Are Still Living With Their Moment of Infamy
description: Water and barley and a few hops into the stands transformed the Indiana Pacers in an instant.

title: Virginia Lynch, Steven Super
description: Virginia C. Lynch and Steven I. Super were married last evening at the Garden City Country Club in Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Peter J. Garry, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated, with Rabbi Alan Stein taking part.

title: Paul Taylors Women Take a Leap Forward
description: THE allure of the Paul Taylor Dance Company, especially in recent years, has leaned in the direction of its men, in all their brawny, bare-chested glory. But the dynamic has shifted, as the companys excellent City Center season this month proved. While the men will never fade into the background  Michael Trusnovec presides over the repertory like a Greek god reborn for the 21st century  it is now the women, led by the companys senior member, Lisa Viola, who with their feminine mystique and splendor fortify the dances.

title: Beauty Makes Its Own Rules
description: IT was about the time that Naomi Campbell wanted to scratch my eyes out (or so a trade glossy informed me) that it became clear to me that she was no ordinary model. It was 1996, and I had written an article for The New York Times Magazine about the English-born model of Jamaican (and also Chinese) ancestry, enumerating her eccentricities and recounting a few of the seemingly numberless stories about the nutty behavior of this gorgeous, magnetic and nearly pathologically petulant young woman with serious anger-management issues.

title: For an Indian Standby, New Name, Added Variety
description: Connecticut has come a long way from its white-bread image. There are now a number of really good Indian restaurants in the state, especially in Fairfield County, and many of them do not pull their fiery punches. A case in point is Bombay, formerly Bombay Bar and Grill, in Westport.

title: Where Chocolate Is the Star
description: Deborah Anns Sweet Shoppe carries an array of candies, including Jelly Bellies, Gummi Bears and old-style lollipops, as well as locally produced ice cream, but it is the chocolate that is likely to make the biggest impression on you. For one thing, there is no escaping the sweetly pungent aroma of it once you enter the store. For another, a prominently positioned glass display case holds more than 75 types of bonbons, pralines and truffles  all handmade at the companys Brookfield plant.

title: Here Comes the Drudge
description: AS grime obscures my domain, I see through the window glass darkly. Spring is not really a time of optimistic budding, of vernal renewal. It is the season of grunge.

title: Yadira Ramos, Jeffrey Herbert
description: Yadira A. Ramos, a daughter of Teresa Prez of Oakland Gardens, Queens, and Jos Ramos of Jamaica, Queens, was married yesterday morning to Jeffrey L. Herbert, a son of Henrietta Herbert and Kirson Herbert of Hockessin, Del. The Rev. Thomas B. Henry, an African Union Methodist minister, officiated at the Mansion on Main Street in Voorhees, N.J., with the Rev. Robert E. Slade, a United Methodist minister, participating.

title: U.C.L.A. Finds Just the Right Gear to Defeat Kansas
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., March 24  The U.C.L.A. basketball pantheon includes 11 national championship trophies, a couple of famous 7-footers and one 96-year-old man.

title: African, American
description: The Alexandrian exile Andr Aciman used to linger in a tatty Upper West Side park just for the bittersweet pleasure of shadowing his surroundings with images from cities hed known and lost, remaking the architecture of the present, as he put it, so as not to write off the past. Dinaw Mengestus first novel is a tale of just such a shadowing of two cities  Washington, where the narrator, Sepha Stephanos, lives in exile, and Addis Ababa, his city of memory and violent expulsion. As Stephanos wanders the half-known, half-remembered roads of Americas capital, he finds himself drawn into conversation with his dead father, murdered before his eyes during Ethiopias Red Terror.

title: Horse Play in Vienna
description: I am compulsively attracted to ceremonies that have survived the social hierarchies they were created to prop up. The Spanish Riding School, one of Viennas most popular tourist attractions, is a particularly eloquent example of this genre. The Hapsburg dynasty bit the dust in 1918. But the familys favorite breed of horse rides on and on as if two world wars had never happened.

title: The Lost Generation
description: This years planned graduation speaker at Columbia College, Matthew Fox, is an inspiring role model, perhaps best known for raising his siblings after the tragic death of their parents. Wait a second. That was his character Charlie Salinger on the television show Party of Five. Certainly the leadership he demonstrated in the wake of a plane crash, helping the survivors on a seemingly deserted island. ... Oh, right. That was the character Jack Shephard on the present hit television show Lost.

title: After Lifetime in Germany, Turks Still Alone and Torn
description: DUISBURG, Germany, March 20  The last cups of Turkish black tea had been drained, the platters of olives and goat cheese cleared, but the snowy-haired Turks lingered at the table.

title: Compassionate Commercialism
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: In Maine, Trying to Protect an Old Way of Life
description: PORT CLYDE, Me.  For generations fishermen have trawled for flounder, haddock and lobster in the waters off this picturesque port, unloading their catch on the docks that line the harbor.

title: After a Powerful Twister, Business Picks Up
description: Hawthorne

title: Long at Ease, an M-16 Reports for Fund-Raising Duty
description: LAPEER, Mich.

title: Reich Star
description: A BRAZEN shout from long trumpets held high at the angle of a Hitler salute. Cut to medium close-up of young Aryan faces with puffed cheeks. Dolly back as two new biographies of Leni Riefenstahl appear virtually at once. Jrgen Trimborns book, well translated from the German by Edna McCown, has the better pictures. Steven Bachs book, backed up by his deep personal experience as a high-echelon film executive handling dingbat directors, has the better text. Though neither book is precisely adulatory, put them together and they add up to an awful lot of attention. She might be dead, but she wont lie down.

title: Porsche Raises Stake in VW, Forcing a Takeover Offer
description: BERLIN, March 24  The German sports-car maker Porsche said Saturday that it would make a takeover bid for Volkswagen, a symbolically audacious but largely legal step in its growing control over VW, Europes largest carmaker and the inventor of the once-ubiquitous Beetle.

title: The Latest Amenity: A Hypoallergenic Room
description: THE room at the Premier Hotel in Times Square looked like any other. But before I stepped inside, the hotel had gone to extraordinary lengths to purify it. In a seven-step process to cut down on bacteria, pollen, dust, dust mites and other possible irritants, everything in the room, from the curtains to the carpeting to the air-conditioning units, was cleaned and treated with an antimicrobial agent that attacks bacteria.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: POLITICAL SIDE OF MYANMAR

title: Early Instruments in Tough New Settings
description: IN a musical world where period-instrument ensembles and new-music ensembles share the same performance spaces and much of the same audience, new music for old instruments is a natural and by-now-familiar development. But in About Baroque, a new recording by the Freiburg Baroque Orchestra from Harmonia Mundi France, the marriage of old hardware and new content takes an unexpected and fascinating turn.

title: Health Care Costs Drive Up School Budgets
description: SCHOOL boards on Long Island and in Westchester face big jumps in health care costs this year that will help force tax increases well above the rate of inflation, according to early numbers from budgets.

title: Reverse Foreign Aid
description: For the last 10 years, people in China have been sending me money. I also get money from countries in Latin America and sub-Saharan Africa  really, from every poor country. Im not the only one whos so lucky. Everyone in a wealthy nation has become the beneficiary of the generous subsidies that poorer countries bestow upon rich ones. Here in the United States, this welfare program in reverse allows our government to spend wildly without runaway inflation, keeps many American businesses afloat and even provides medical care in parts of the country where doctors are scarce.

title: The Brain and Baseball (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: On the Q.T.: Michael Kors
description: If only Hawaii were closer, Michael Kors would be a commuter. Im a little island-obsessed, admits the peripatetic fashion designer, who just introduced his latest fragrance, Island Michael Kors Hawaii. Between stops, Kors took the T Travel Questionnaire.

title: Mountain High, Budget Low
description: AS picnic lunches go, this was about as close to perfect as they get: a length of garlic sausage, a cone of fresh chvre studded with scallions, a loaf of crusty bread and a half-bottle of good Swiss wine. And before us lay a classic Alpine landscape: snow-blanketed gray crags dissolving into evergreen forests dotted with peak-roofed chalets; on the valley floor, a small river wended its way toward the Rhone. My wife, Jean, and I had no table, but the blue sky and warm sun made our snowy perch as comfortable as any picnic blanket in a summer field.

title: Charming Menus Hang On
description: Tompkins Square Park in the East Village, the site of rioting in 1988, has long been a quiet oasis for the affluent white-collar professionals who live in luxury condos nearby. While real estate prices in the neighborhood have risen sharply, these restaurants are still affordable.

title: For a War Rarely Honored, a Disputed Memorial
description: Beverly McDermott, a diminutive 63-year-old with a gray bob and big round sunglasses, stood on the snow-covered grass in Kissena Park last week and frowned at a newly erected chain-link construction fence.

title: Made in Manhattan
description: FEW 28-year-olds can pull off a pocket square. Dana Vachon comes close. Of course, he has the pedigree. Born in Greenwich, Conn., raised in Chappaqua, N.Y., a graduate of Duke: all noted on the jacket of his first novel, Mergers and Acquisitions, a roman  clef about his stint as a JP Morgan analyst, which is scheduled to come out on April 5. And, of course, he has sold the movie rights, to the production company Anonymous Content, of Babel fame.

title: Reagan, Above Average? (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Living Up to the View Can Be a Challenge
description: A SHELTERING canopy and trees strung with miniature lights mark the entrance to Mulinos of Westchester, as though it were a private club or a glamorous hideaway. Inside this cellar enclave, a mirrored wall that runs through the bar and lounge reflects the dazzle and sparkle of an extensive collection of glass and crystal: tall decanters, Swarovski figures, vases. The bilevel dining room, just beyond the lounge area, looks out onto an attractive garden and waterfall. The food, however, was generally less successful than the view.

title: Correction: Paperback Row
description: A brief item in the Paperback Row column on March 11, about A Family Daughter, a novel by Maile Meloy, misstated the year in which Meloy begins to follow her protagonist, Abby Santerre. It is 1979, not 1969.

title: Star Search
description: Allison Samuels never met a celebrity she didnt like. Well, except maybe the onetime Death Row Records honcho Suge Knight, whose preferred topic of conversation  far-flung theories about the contents of Hollywoods closet  proved less than riveting. Samuels, a correspondent in Newsweeks Los Angeles bureau, doesnt gush about Knight. But hes the rare exception; reading Off the Record, her behind-the-scenes report on Hollywood, hip-hop and sports, one gets the impression that by and large, celebrities are eminently affable: courteous, captivating and sometimes in possession of more highbrow reading material than wed expect (who knew Mike Tyson could talk Tolstoy?).

title: Genetic News, Borne With Grace (5 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Online Yesterday, on Cable Today
description: THIS was a crowd in desperate need of being warmed up. On a March night that felt like the coldest of the year, a few dozen young comedy fans who had lined up in Chelsea expecting to attend a late-night showcase called Crash Test instead found themselves transported by van to the westernmost edge of 26th Street, to shiver in front of an MTV camera crew.

title: Wandering Wetterich Has Only Woods in Way
description: MIAMI, March 24  The man with the best chance to take down Tiger Woods in the CA Championship was not even on the PGA Tour two years ago. Brett Wetterich is a product of minitours, long-drive contests and Wallace State Community College.

title: Confessions on a Dubai Dance Floor
description: Its 2:30 a.m. at Club Africana, a dim room in the back of the seedy Rush Inn Hotel in the old town of Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and a 15-member Congolese band called Bilenge Musica is rocking the house. Six vocalists sway in sync, while the nine-piece band lays down a blend of hip-hop and African dance-hall rhythms for a crowd of 150. Dancing near the stage are a sweaty clutch of African construction workers, fresh from their 12-hour shifts. Sitting at the tables behind them are men from the Arab merchant class and their bejeweled girlfriends. At the back of the room, I spot a few American and English expatriates timidly checking out the scene. All these people have come to Dubai to work and make some money, says Bilenge Musicas manager, Lesasa Joker, surveying the crowd. And on their day off, if they have one, they come here.

title: The Wonder Land of Socotra, Yemen
description: The road to the forest of frankincense trees, on the Yemeni island of Socotra, is a rough one. From the passenger seat of a battered Toyota Land Cruiser, it looked like pure rock pile, on and on, up, down, over. Ahmed Said, my driver and guide, wrestled the wheel like a man engaged, surely and calmly, in a struggle to the death. When at last, after 90 minutes, he stopped and got out, we had traveled perhaps no more than five miles.

title: Jill Rothkopf, Jonathan Steinberg
description: Jill Caryn Rothkopf, a daughter of Sally Rothkopf and James Rothkopf of Stamford, Conn., was married last evening to Jonathan Ian Steinberg, the son of Rene Steinberg and Richard Steinberg of New York. Rabbi David J. Gelfand officiated at the Angel Orensanz Foundation for the Arts in New York.

title: Girl Scouts for the New Century
description: Briarcliff

title: Saudis Bar Israeli Covering U.N. Chiefs Trip
description: CAIRO, March 24  The United Nations said Saturday that Saudi Arabia had barred entry to a Washington-based Israeli journalist traveling with Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.

title: When Will Fredo Get Whacked?
description: PRESIDENT BUSH wants to keep everything that happens in his White House secret, but when it comes to his own emotions, hes as transparent as a teenager on MySpace.

title: 5 Held in Bronx Shooting, Including One of the Victims
description: Five people were arrested after a gunfight in the Bronx on Friday night, including a 16-year-old boy who fired at police officers, the bodega clerk who gave him the gun, and one of the shooting victims, the authorities said yesterday.

title: A New Art Districts Raw Charm
description: NOT long ago, Brunnenstrasse  a road that starts on the northern edge of Mitte, the trendy center of Berlin  looked like an elegy to post-communism. Gray facades, graffiti, even an outpost of the sex-shop chain Beate Uhse, made it seem immune to gentrification.

title: Pas de Tous!
description: The fashion designer Jean Paul Gaultier has achieved pop-star status in France the way only fashion designers can achieve pop-star status in France. (Madonna? Isnt she that singer who wore the conical Gaultier bra?) Last year, Frances No. 1 enfant terrible celebrated his 30th anniversary in the business. Yet weirdly enough, he has never had a major exhibition of his work there. Well, not counting the Pain Couture show at the Cartier Foundation in 2004, where all of the clothes were recreated from bread.

title: Editors Note
description: The cover article in The Times Magazine on March 18 reported on women who served in Iraq, the sexual abuse that some of them endured and the struggle for all of them to reclaim their prewar lives. One of the servicewomen, Amorita Randall, a former naval construction worker, told The Times that she was in combat in Iraq in 2004 and that in one incident an explosive device blew up a Humvee she was riding in, killing the driver and leaving her with a brain injury. She also said she was raped twice while she was in the Navy.

title: A 3-Cylinder Slug
description: WHAT WAS IT? The 1990-94 Justy, Subarus last attempt to market an inexpensive subcompact to Americans.

title: Making Managers Pay, Literally
description: SHAREHOLDERS have been rightly aggrieved in recent years at their boards reluctance to recover money paid to executives involved in financial misconduct. While cooking the books to generate hefty pay became common in Scandalot  what regulators say happened at Fannie Mae, Bristol-Myers Squibb and Computer Associates  instances where even some of that money was returned to shareholders have been depressingly rare.

title: A Bounty of Events for Flower Lovers
description: What better way to celebrate the return of spring than by tiptoeing through the tulips in Holland at the Keukenhof gardens, where Dutch bulb growers are showing off more than seven million buds from now through May 20. Information: www.keukenhof.nl; admission is 13 euros, or $17.55 at $1.35 to the euro. Though Amsterdam is only 40 minutes away, the recently refurbished and appropriately named Golden Tulip (www.goldentulipleiden.nl) in nearby Leiden has double rooms starting at 139 euros a night.

title: Martha Flach and Austin Wilkie
description: Martha Elisabeth Flach was married yesterday to Austin Tack Wilkie at the Players club in Manhattan. Harold Silverman, a retired State Supreme Court justice in the Bronx, officiated.

title: Phelps Fixated on Gold Rush a Year Before the Olympics
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Sunday, March 25  With the world swimming championships under way Sunday, Michael Phelps was scheduled to do something out of character during the morning session  rest.

title: In a Shaky Economy, a Laggard May Find Its Legs
description: AROUND this time last year, many investors were convinced that the market was sinking  or that even if the bull wasnt drowning, the investment waters were becoming much more treacherous.

title: Lanka Rebels Reported to Bomb Base
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Monday, March 26  Tamil Tiger rebels bombed an air force base next to Sri Lankas international airport, north of Colombo, before dawn on Monday from a light aircraft, Reuters reported the Air Force as saying. The attack killed two airmen and wounded 17.

title: Back-Street Beijing
description: As the city prepares for the 2008 Summer Olympics, Beijing's historic lanes, or hutongs, are disappearing in a dust cloud of new construction. But South Gong and Drum Lane (Nan Luoguxiang) is an exception. Near the central lakes, the 700-year-old hutong is a bit of authentic bohemia in an otherwise Starbucks-saturated central city.

title: Abracadabra: Lifting the Lid Off the Box
description: CONVERSATION and dancing at the Box, a new club in dinner-theater drag on the Lower East Side, slowed to a standstill as the Hammerstein Beauties, a troupe of dancers in feathered Bazooka-pink headdresses and matching beaded two-pieces sauntered their way through the room and onto the tiny stage.

title: The Evolution of a City, in Words and Pictures
description: THE SUBURBANIZATION OF NEW YORK

title: Tara Purohit and Riad Abrahams
description: Tara Balmaceda Purohit and Riad Muhammad Abrahams were married yesterday at Capitale, an event space in New York. Bettina Yiannakourou, a nondenominational minister, officiated.

title: Frances Le Perche Is the Last Terroir
description: When my friend Michle Champenois, a writer for Le Monde in Paris, invited my husband and me for the weekend in Le Perche, I was intrigued. Wheres that? I wondered. I was born in Paris but had never heard of Le Perche, nor had any of my relatives in France. Its two hours from Paris, I was told, in lower Normandy, not far from Chartres. It has glorious manoirs and chateaus and is famous for its Percheron, Michle wrote to me, the noblest, absolutely most gorgeous horses in the world.

title: Are Tax Revenues Flashing Red or Green?
description: AT Wal-Mart, whose sales depend on the fortunes of the broad consuming public, sales growth has been sluggish. At Saks, which caters to shoppers with more disposable income, sales growth has been impressive. Its as if these two national retailers are operating in two different economies.

title: Judith Verdino and Imani Romney-Rosa
description: Judith Verdino and Imani Romney-Rosa are to affirm their partnership this afternoon at the Packer Collegiate Institute in Brooklyn. Barbara J. Turk, a friend of the couple who is a student at the Union Theological Seminary, is to perform the commitment ceremony.

title: Prices Arent Supersonic; the Planes Arent Either
description: MORE than four million people have passed through the gleaming glass transit hub in Howard Beach, in far southeastern Queens, since it opened in December 2003, with the purpose of catching a light-rail AirTrain to or from Kennedy International Airport.

title: India Made Easy
description: FOR the first-time visitor to India, the sheer vastness of the country  more than a million square miles  all but defeats the romantic notion of seeing all that this place has to offer in anything approaching the usual time frame of a normal vacation. Retirees no longer punching the clock, college students who want to take a couple of semesters off, backpackers on a global journey of exploration: these are the kinds of travelers that India seems made for.

title: Stocks Surge as the Fed Eases Worries
description: The stock market surged last week in its best weekly performance in many months on optimism that the economy will continue to expand without setting off high inflation.

title: Calendar of Events
description: Music and Dance

title: Loss-Assessment Riders: Are They Necessary?
description: Q A recent letter from our managing agent about our co-ops insurance coverage suggested that residents homeowners policies include a loss-assessment rider to cover certain types of losses incurred by the corporation, which would then be assessed on all shareholders in the form a loss assessment. Is the suggested rider necessary, or is it simply a matter of cost shifting by the co-op?

title: The Polished Traveler
description: Much like her signature crystal pendants and striking gold rings and cuff bracelets, Temple St. Clair Carrs wardrobe has an elegant Old World patina.

title: Oden Responds to Challenge With a Strong Second Half
description: SAN ANTONIO, March 24  Joey Dorsey, the Memphis junior forward, created a stir Friday when he told members of the news media that he thought Greg Oden, Ohio States touted freshman center, was overrated.

title: Under the Rainbow
description: ON New Years Eve, about 50 guests crammed into Addison Smiths apartment, a fourth-floor walk-up in a former tenement on Ninth Avenue near 51st Street. The party had been billed as a refuge for friends who were still at loose ends for the holiday, and most of the merrymakers were 20- and 30-something gay men, many of whom lived in the neighborhood.

title: Tacos, With a Lebanese Twist
description: Tacos al pastor, made with chili-soaked pork spit-roasted beneath a dripping, slowly caramelizing pineapple, are a popular street snack in Mexico City. And New Rochelles Little Mexican Cafe offers the genuine article, as you can plainly see if you sit at its worn wooden bar. The electric spit is strung with marinated pork pieces running with the amber juices of the pineapple above. The pork is wrapped in warm corn tortillas along with chopped cilantro and onion. (Ask for a couple of chunks of roasted pineapple to be added to the mix.)

title: The Mysteries of the Dead
description: John Banville has chosen Benjamin Black as the pen name for a project that may be his own guilty pleasure  a classic, hard-boiled crime novel. More than a seamless performance in fulfilling the demands of its genre, Christine Falls is executed with what feels like authorial delight.

title: Katherine Orff, Oded Horodniceanu
description: Katherine Ruth Orff, a daughter of Linda and Robert E. Orff of Crofton, Md., was married last evening to Oded Horodniceanu, a son of Bat-Sheva and Michael F. Horodniceanu of Forest Hills, Queens. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated at the Palm House in the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Boom and Bust
description: Postwar European history falls neatly into two periods. From 1945 to 1973, the countries of Western Europe recovered rapidly from the almost unimaginable devastation caused by World War II and then took off, growing faster than the United States and more than twice as fast as their own historical trends. From 1973 to the present, however, their economies have struggled with low growth and high unemployment, lagging behind both international competitors and their own earlier success.

title: Finding a Stylish Hotel Even Kids Will Enjoy
description: When it comes to hotels, kid friendly and hip would seem to be incompatible adjectives. But TabletHotels, a booking site devoted to matching travelers with sophisticated accommodations around the world, has a new offspring: TabletKids, designed for families who want to travel in style.

title: Portlands Retro Fit Hotel
description: For Alex Calderwood, Wade Weigel, Doug Herrick and Jack Barron  whose 79-room Ace Hotel opened in Portland, Ore., last month  good design is about tapping into a citys lifeblood. We want guests to wake up in their rooms and feel immediately that theyre in Portland and couldnt be anywhere else, Calderwood says.

title: Whats on Sunday Night
description: 9 P.M (HBO) ROME Ancient Rome, and this series, above comes to an end as Mark Antony returns to Alexandria to be with Cleopatra, and Pullo is ordered to track down Caesarian and Vorenus.

title: New Player Is About to Join the Same Old Knicks
description: When they reconvene today at their suburban training center, the Knicks will welcome a new player, and the talk will turn once more toward the future. Randolph Morris, signed Friday, will become the new symbol of hope, and a distraction from the suddenly messy present.

title: Success in Nascar Isnt a Sure Thing for Montoya
description: Juan Pablo Montoya, the Nascar neophyte, showed up to sign autographs at his racing teams merchandise trailer before a Nascar Nextel Cup race last weekend in suburban Atlanta. The crowd stunned him.

title: A Look That Says North Fork
description: MANY scenic areas have a signature style. There are, to name a few, the Cape Cod style, the Malibu Beach house, the Hamptons shingle cottage.

title: Snipping a Vine and Sowing Dismay
description: CHARLES DEAN and Clyde Wachsberger know all about the passion that plants can incite.

title: On Idol, the South Rises Again ... and Again
description: WHEN Rachael Zevitas, an 18-year-old New Yorker, received her golden ticket to Hollywood during the recent auditions for American Idol, she promised to end five years of regional domination. The South has had a lock down on the American Idol; this year its New York, she boasted to the camera.

title: Feeling Lucky?: Casinos Get Their Global Game On
description: The average visit to Atlantic City used to last three hours, and its not hard to remember why. If you werent gambling, you werent losing to the house, and this left casinos little incentive to wine and dine you. Today, of course, all thats changed: the marriage of gambling to dining, shopping and culture has glamorized the casino experience, and over-the-top has become the new run-of-the-mill. Americans, for their part, have embraced the highbrow-lowbrow mishmash of places like Las Vegas and Connecticuts Mohegan Sun, and now a little roulette between shopping at Prada and dinner at Thomas Kellers Bouchon seems like light entertainment on par with seeing Celine Dion. Its a phenomenon that has proved highly lucrative (Ceasars Forum in Las Vegas is North Americas highest-grossing shopping area per square foot) and easily exportable, thereby reshaping not only the culture of gaming but also how and where we travel.

title: Home Turf
description: ITS a beautiful place, Donald Trump said of his Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster, about 50 miles west of Manhattan. He considers the links so lovely, in fact, that he wants to reside there in perpetuity.

title: Kristin Stodola, Andrew Kramer
description: Kristin Marie Stodola, the daughter of Judith A. Stodola and John E. Stodola of Onalaska, Wis., was married last evening to Andrew Louis Kramer, a son of Frederic S. Kramer of Roslyn, N.Y., and the late Barbara B. Kramer. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated at the Racquet and Tennis Club in New York.

title: Hat Tricks in Montappone, Italy
description: One of the dividends of a trip to an obscure place like Montappone, Italy  an austere hill town in Le Marche and the center of Italian hat production  is how it can suddenly press your replay button. Twenty-five years ago I used to go to the races at Longchamp. Marie-Helene de Rothschild ruled Paris then, yet it wasnt the queen bee who stole the show but an antique countess, Simone Saint-Just, with her exquisitely cocked trilby. Later, at a society wedding I covered, Helene Rochass efforts to bag Stavros Niarchos were thwarted by a badly proportioned Saint Laurent pillbox worn too far forward on the forehead. And once at tea in the Rue Bonaparte apartment of Madeleine Castaing, she proceeded to drag out all her beautiful old hatboxes from the legendary modiste Paulette. Thats three Big Hat Moments.

title: Regular Season Is an 82-Game Preliminary
description: Hockey may be the only sport in which fans do not root for their team to finish first.

title: Musharraf Finds Himself Weakened After Firing of Judge
description: ISLAMABAD, March 24  For the past seven years, the Pakistani judiciary has swallowed hard to accommodate the military rule of Gen. Pervez Musharraf, repeatedly bending in matters of law and constitution.

title: Correction: Just for Laughs: Newer Than New Wave
description: An article on March 11 about Chris Rocks I Think I Love My Wife and other remakes of French New Wave films misidentified to the actress who tempts Mr. Rocks character. She is Kerry Washington, not Gina Torres.

title: Portrayal of Mandela, Liberated
description: PRESTON

title: A Business Grows and a Family Follows, Under the Same Roof
description: ITS easy to find the home of Lexy Funk and Vahap Avsar, owners of Brooklyn Industries, the chain of clothing stores that now has three branches in Manhattan.

title: Kerry Newman, Paul Sullivan
description: Kerry Anne Newman was married yesterday to Paul Thomas Sullivan in Ballintubber, Ireland. The Rev. M. Christen Beirne, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Ballintubber Abbey.

title: A Withering Audit
description: The Nassau County Clerk, Maureen OConnell, did not invent or install the alarmingly creaky administrative systems and procedures that her office uses to do its job. But she has run the place since 2006, long enough to assume the brunt of responsibility for the appalling weaknesses revealed in an audit of her office released last week by Howard Weitzman, the county comptroller.

title: G.M. Makes a Grand Entrance, at Last, to the Crossover Ball
description: LIKE a red-faced college student begging his mother not to show visitors the embarrassing old family photos, General Motors would like you to forget its early attempts at car-based crossover utility vehicles. Imagine the company wincing on the sofa as you chuckle your way through G.M.s picture albums from the 90s, filled with snapshots of the Pontiac Aztek and Buick Rendezvous  the vehicular equivalent of acne and braces, velour dickies and the mullet.

title: Health Care Costs Drive Up School Budgets
description: SCHOOL boards in Westchester and on Long Island face big jumps in health care costs this year that will help force tax increases well above the rate of inflation, according to early numbers from budgets in the region.

title: Head Trip
description: The moment possessed that rare, rapturous feeling of a dream come true. Adam Greenberg knelt in the on-deck circle, awaiting his first at-bat in his first major-league game. He had arrived at this occasion by successfully ascending all those smaller steps along the way: Little League, Legion ball, high-school ball, college ball, the minor leagues. He was 24 now, an outfielder playing his best baseball ever. The Chicago Cubs had promoted him from their Double A farm club in West Tennessee. Greenie, get a bat, youre hitting for the pitcher, Dick Pole, the bench coach, told him in the top of the ninth. The Cubs were up 4-2 over the Florida Marlins. It was a Saturday night, July 2005. Towers of beaming light fended off the dark for a Miami crowd of nearly 23,000. The air was steamy. A pelting rain had left the grass with its deepest color. As Adam left the dugout, he wrapped his hands around his favorite bat, a Zinger model X53, a 34-incher with a black head and a cherry handle. He breathed in the familiar smell of the polished wood. Dusty Baker, the Cubs manager, called out encouragingly, Cmon, Greenie, get on!

title: Its a Brawl. Chinas Gamblers Are the Prize.
description: Macao

title: 47 Are Killed in Iraq Bombings, 20 in Baghdad
description: BAGHDAD, March 24  A suicide bomber driving a truck carrying explosives hidden under construction materials on Saturday was waved through a checkpoint at a heavily fortified police compound in southern Baghdad, where he detonated his payload, killing at least 20 people, an Interior Ministry official said.

title: Capsule Collection
